results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

Looking forward to training with you!

Presenter: Michael Posso / Web Developer, Oracle.


Data visualization has become an essential skill for all digital experiences. As data becomes more available to the public, there is a need to create creative and efficient way of presenting that data on the web. D3 is a javascript library that creates dynamic data driven experiences for the web.

In this meetup we will go over a simple way of creating a graph using SVG graphics. This is an introductory talk that will explore the benefits of using D3 and SVG graphics for your next data visualization project. We will also cover some public data sources available for your own projects.

7:00 to 8:30

ThoughtWorks / 99 Madison Ave / 15 floor

Learn mor here: https://d3js.org/

results.description:
This film is part of the Panorama Europe 2016 series at MOMI:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jnOLsCGV8XQ

With director Rebecca Cremona in person 
Presented by the Arts Council Malta

New York Premiere. Malta. Dir. Rebecca Cremona. 2014,
101 mins. In Maltese and English with English subtitles.
With Lofti Abdelli, Jimi Busuttil, Sékouba Doucouré. 

A landmark for Maltese cinema, Simshar is the country’s first film to receive international distribution and its first submission for the Foreign Language Academy Award. It is a heartrending tale of life and death on the Mediterranean in which the intersecting fates of two boats stranded at sea—one containing a fishing family, the other African migrants in need of medical attention—culminates in shocking tragedy. Based on a true story, Simshar is both a gripping survival story and a compassionate, humanizing look at Europe’s migrant crisis.


Admission is free, on a first-come, first-seated basis.  Please get there a little early.

Update:  All extra tickets have been claimed.

Since events of this kind typically fill up quickly, I recommend that you arrive early.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates regarding this event.

Originally posted 5/7/16. 
Update on 5/19/16

results.name: Maltese Film:  Simshar (2014) w/director Rebecca Cremona in person -- Free!

results.description:
Join us for a book discussion as we review The Girl in the Red Coat by Kate Hammer. I figure a month should give everyone enough time to read at their own pace. We'll host our discussion at Mosaic Lounge, which has a wide selection of wine and craft beer.

Story line: Newly single mom Beth has one constant, gnawing worry: that her dreamy eight-year-old daughter, Carmel, who has a tendency to wander off, will one day go missing.


And then one day, it happens: On a Saturday morning thick with fog, Beth takes Carmel to a local outdoor festival, they get separated in the crowd, and Carmel is gone.

Shattered, Beth sets herself on the grim and lonely mission to find her daughter, keeping on relentlessly even as the authorities tell her that Carmel may be gone for good.

Carmel, meanwhile, is on a strange and harrowing journey of her own—to a totally unexpected place that requires her to live by her wits, while trying desperately to keep in her head, at all times, a vision of her mother …

Alternating between Beth’s story and Carmel’s, and written in gripping prose that won’t let go, The Girl in the Red Coat—like Emma Donoghue’s Room and M. L. Stedman’s The Light Between Oceans—is an utterly immersive story that’s impossible to put down . . . and impossible to forget.
results.name: Book: The Girl in the Red Coat

results.description:
All small businesses are in desperate need of competent legal advice and legal services, but everywhere you turn there are attorneys who charge a lot and do nothing.


At this meeting we will share some horror stories and warning signs, as well as some strategies to give your small business access to affordable legal advice and services.


One horror story is the small businesswoman who paid an attorney $3000 for a simple letter that the attorney botched. When the letter backfired and she wound up in court she couldn't get so much as a return call from the attorney. How can you prevent this from happening to you?

While many of events are free, there is a $10 charge for this event. But members who attend will receive a $5 rebate for having attended (member must fill out rebate form before leaving).

(Affordable lawyers, after you have RSVP'd, please feel free to post your services/ introductions in the comments section)
results.name: How to Find Affordable Lawyers for Your Business!!

results.description:
In collaboration with the Centro de Experimentación del Teatro Colón (CETC), Music of the Americas presents the U.S. premiere of the multimedia monodrama Inteligencia Artificial, by Miguel Galperin and Ignacio Llobera. The piece is based on the reflections of an ordinary man, fascinated by artificial intelligence, and takes the form of a monologue. The sets, designed by visionary Brazilian collective SuperUber , juxtapose man's temporality with the universe of memory, data processing, and the enduring legacy of artificial intelligence, which draws a comparison between the domain of the organic and artificial. Starring Argentine actor Marcelo Delgado, the nonlinear narrative is divided into two stages: the first focuses on the central character's relationship with time, and the second on his relationship with the multiple identities he crafted in the artificial world. Throughout the work, videos are projected onto suspended translucent screen modules, visually expanding the world of the narrator. 

https://player.vimeo.com/video/150053759


Admission: FREE for AS and YPA Members. Tickets may be purchased in advance through the theater's box office: $20 for non-members and $10 for students and seniors. Prices include all online service fees.

Tickets are now available through the Dixon Place box office here.
results.name: Opera: Inteligencia Artificial

results.description:
We're excited to announce the launching of new staff-run RPG events at the Brooklyn Strategist! Check out the details for each event below, and be sure to RSVP for your table by following this link: bstrat.eventsmart.com

D&D 5E, "Lost in the Sands": Dungeons & Dragons is a game take on heroic roles and interact with each other and the Dungeon Master to experience fantasy, fights, and epic storytelling. Run by the Strategist’s professional Dungeon Master Ben Williams, this program will offer guidance to beginner players new to the rules of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), while still providing a veteran level experience. The campaign will be set in the Dungeon Master’s custom world, Unisum, allowing players a greater degree of character customization and incorporation into the world’s story, while still using 5th edition basic rules and content as a base. Play will consist of a mixture of roleplaying and combat with a focus on long-term story. Character creation, background-building, group play style and other game elements will be covered in the first session. Please contact Ben at [masked] with questions. This campaign will be supported by an Obsidian Portal webpage. Campaign details and background lore can be found at https://lostinthesands.obsidianportal.com/.

Call of Cthulhu 7E, "Masks of Nyarlathotep": Call of Cthulhu is a game of surreal horror in which players strive to uncover a vast and mysterious cosmic conspiracy before losing their lives or their sanity. Run by the Strategist’s professional Keeper of Secret Timm Woods, this program will offer instruction to players new to the rules of Call of Cthulhu (7th Edition), while accommodating advanced play for veteran gamers. Players will begin with the classic introductory Call of Cthulhu scenario “The Haunting” before transitioning into the award-winning “Masks of Nyarlathotep”. Character creation, background-building, and other elements of campaign play will be covered in the first session. Please contact Timm at [masked] with questions.

Remember that signing up for the Meetup event does NOT guarantee you a spot. Follow the link to our registration page and reserve your seat for free immediately!

results.description:
3D Thursday 5/19

John Fitzpatrick shows us how to monetize your 3D printing hobby so it at least pays for breakfast and maybe more. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

www.fitz.com

https://www.3dhubs.com/new-york/hubs/fitzcom

https://www.myminifactory.com/users/FitzNYC

http://www.shapeways.com/shops/fitz/

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting!

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: How to monetize your 3D printing hobby!

results.description:
We are partnering up with Maker Square to bring you a beginner-to-intermediate survey of JavaScript's capabilities and strengths.  Maker Square's experienced faculty will walk us through beginner use cases with some curriculum material, then open it up for questions with the group.


In this session you will learn the basics of the following:

• Conditional statements


• Arrays


• Loops


The instructor will be Tyler Lambe. Tyler was a professional developer across all platforms for over 6 years, before he made the transition into teaching full-stack web development. Having crafted full-fledged software engineers who previously had no experience, his passion lies in helping people accelerate their lives through education.

If you have questions or topics you'd like covered, please drop a comment below!

Please note that this is part of our Jam Session format, which is kept to smaller groups so that participants can feel comfortable sharing and discussing.

We will serve beverages for you, but please bring your own snacks/dinner.

See you then and Rock On!
results.name: Jam Session v.004: Legal Hacking with JavaScript

results.description:
Discover (or re-visit!) the work of the legendary John Cassavetes with this 35mm screening of Husbands. After the film, head upstairs to Metrograph's restaurant and bar, The Commissary, to meet other film-lovers and chat about how we're so glad we don't live in the suburbs.

IMPORTANT:

- As Metrograph is a small, two-screen theater with reserved seating, we highly suggest that you purchase your tickets in advance to both guarantee a ticket and select a preferable seat.

http://metrograph.com/film/film/163/husbands


- Meeting spot: Metrograph at 7:00 PM
The film begins at 7:15 PM but since there's reserved seating, there won't be a mad dash for the prime seats. We'll gather in the lobby for a quick meet and greet and then head into the screening. Look for "Jonathan" - I'll be wearing a name tag.

- After the screening we'll gather in the lobby and head upstairs to Metrograph's restaurant and bar, The Commissary.

1970 / 131min / 35mm
Director: John Cassavetes
Cast: Ben Gazzara, John Cassavetes, Peter Falk
Writer: John Cassavetes
Producer: Al Ruban
Cinematography: Victor J. Kemper

Maximum-impact Cassavetes. The director-star pushes his actors and cinematic techniques to the extreme in this account of three married suburban New York dads - Cassavetes and two of his standbys, Ben Gazzara and Peter Falk - who, after reuniting following a friend’s funeral, leave their wives and kids for a brutally masculine weekend of binge-drinking and roughhousing. The rowdiest of all the writer-director’s films, Husbands brilliantly blurs the line between reality and performance.

(Above text taken from Metrograph's website.)
results.name: John Cassavetes's "Husbands" at Metrograph + Drinks at The Commissary

results.description:
It's time for the May session of NightShul!

NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. 

We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through May 26.

Offerings:


-Kosher Korean Cooking taught by Jinah Park Kamil (must sign up for full month of class, class size limited to 10 people, additional $30 materials fee applies)

-Rashi and his Methodology taught by Cantor Sam Levine

-Selected Shorts from the Tanakh taught by Rabbi Sue Oren


-Lev Tahor: Mindfulness Practice in Jewish Culture taught by Rabbi Sara Zacharia

SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SIGN UP. $15 FOR ONE NIGHT, $35 FOR MAY SESSION, SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR FULL SEASON PRICING.
results.name: Let's create a community of adult Jewish learners-- May session

results.description:
New York Writers Intensive will be offering an informational Storytelling event to promote our new series of classes starting in June. We would love to know what you are looking for in storytelling classes and events. 

The 6-week course is called: "Writing the Story: Storytelling for Entrepreneurs, Professionals, and Creatives." It's for anyone who wants to use storytelling elements to their advantage in their business, creative works, and personal life. 

May 19th at 7pm. Jay will be giving out some GREAT content about what you will learn in his course and it will help us know what people are interested in. It's just $5 and there will be snacks!  

I hope you all come out and join us! 

Bellow is more information about the course:

The 6-week course "Writing the Story: Storytelling for Entrepreneurs, Professionals, and Creatives"

Use storytelling techniques to increase your impact in writing, business, and life! 

• Do you want to write but need help getting started? 

• Have stories you want to tell but need help getting them down?

• Want to tap into your creativity and self-expression? 

• You always wanted to write, but you’re in a job where you can’t be creative?

Then sign up for our Writing the Story, our storytelling class at The New York Writers' Intensive, taught by award-winning journalist and storyteller Jay Dixit. When: May 19th 7pm 


This is a writing class for anyone who wants to learn to use the techniques of storytelling to increase their impact. 

WHAT OUR STUDENTS ARE SAYING 

“One of the top three creative writing classes I have ever taken—and the other two were full semesters’ worth. I’d definitely take any creative writing class or workshop by Jay. His class could easily turn into a TED Talk. He engages the entire class and remembers everyone’s name. He’s a great teacher because his delivery is flawless… devil is in the details.” —Rob Luciano

In this class, you will learn: 

• how to tap into your creativity, find your voice, and tell a story that captivates people 

• how to create a plot using the principles of story structure 

• how to use drama, how to use suspense, tension, and conflict to hook your readers 

• how to express yourself and your personality in an honest, authentic way that connects with people 

No matter what kind of writing you’re doing, the principles of storytelling are universal, and this class will enable you to:

• write a first-person essay for The New York Times' Modern Love column 

• write your bio on your company's website 

• start a blog and write posts that go viral

• do a TED talk 

• tell a story on stage at The Moth that will have the audience on the edge of their seat 

• write a novel, short story, memoir, or screenplay 

• write a pitch deck for investors that will get your company funded 

• have better conversations 

• meet and connect with people at a conference or networking event 

• tell a story at a cocktail party that will have everyone hanging on your every word

This class is fun and interactive, balancing classroom instruction with fun creativity exercises to help you get unstuck and start writing. Because the principles of storytelling are universal, the class draws on examples not only from the great writers, but also from other genres, including: 


• great storytellers like Louis CK, Alfred Hitchcock, and Woody Allen 

• great writers like Tina Fey, Nabokov, Hemingway, and Joan Didion

• stories from The Moth and This American Life 

• the most captivating and engaging TED talks 

• comic essayists like David Sedaris, David Rakoff, Elizabeth Gilbert, and Sloane Crosley 

• comedians like Louis CK, Ricky Gervais, Tina Fey, and Amy Schumer

• essays from The New York Times "Modern Love" column 

• television like Breaking Bad, The Walking Dead, and Louie

• movies like The Princess Bride, Star Wars, and Pulp Fiction

Sign up and start writing today!



WHAT IS NEW YORK WRITERS' INTENSIVE?
We are the New York Writers Intensive, a community of people passionate about learning the writing and storytelling skills to connect with readers and customers. 


ABOUT JAY DIXIT
Jay Dixit is a science writer, editor, and storytelling teacher whose work has appeared in The New York Times, The Washington Post, Rolling Stone, Slate, Wired, and Psychology Today. 

Through Jay's years of experience as a writer and storyteller, Jay has noticed the key points and sweet spots of great storytelling, which not everybody teaches you when you are learning how to write. He has developed a meta-course that breaks down the fundamentals of good storytelling, how to optimize creativity, and apply these storytelling techniques in all areas of life. 

Jay will teach you how to cultivate creativity, push through writer's block and procrastination, to fulfill your potential. Learn from the greats to become great! His energy and insight provides a supportive environment for people to learn and grow and he has the testimonials to prove it! 

This is a one-off class that lasts two hours. For the full 6-week storytelling class, sign up here by May 19 and get $20 off: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/writing-the-story-storytelling-for-writers-entrepreneurs-professionals-and-other-creative-people-tickets-25036919099
results.name: Writing the Story: Storytelling for Entrepreneurs, Professionals, and Creatives

results.description:
(This meetup date was accidentally double-posted; we've deleted the duplicate event posting, but this Thursday's meetup is NOT canceled. Apologies for any confusion!)

***


Join us for an open-format discussion of effective altruism topics! If anyone would like to make announcements or propose a discussion topic, we suggest you do so on the the EA-NYC Facebook group page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/730477820377431/

For newcomers, read on:

If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategies, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk: 
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum, or read Will MacAskill's excellent book on the topic, Doing Good Better -- and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris
results.name: Effective altruism discussion meetup

results.description:
3D Thursday 5/19 : How to monetize your 3D printing hobby!


John Fitzpatrick shows us how to monetize your 3D printing hobby so it at least pays for breakfast and maybe more. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


www.fitz.com

https://www.3dhubs.com/new-york/hubs/fitzcom


https://www.myminifactory.com/users/FitzNYC

http://www.shapeways.com/shops/fitz/


---

3D Thursdays!


So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

You will feel great, slightly exhausted, and very smiley at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!

results.description:
An educational opportunity for parents and practitioners.

Presentation by Dr. Lawrence Palevsky, a board certified pediatrician who utilizes a holistic approach to children’s wellness and illness.

• What is current vaccine science and who is funding it and doing it?

• How do vaccines work, and have they done, and do they do what we’re told they do?

• What role do vaccine ingredients play when injected into infants and children?

• What do the ingredients do to our children once they’re injected?

• Do vaccines contribute to the development of chronic illnesses in children?

• How do our children get into school if they’re not vaccinated?

• How does the immune system work in babies and children?

Attendees will hear some of the answers to these questions, along with the research that questions whether vaccines are safe and effective, and whether the scientific process is even at work to prove the answers to these questions. Attendees will also be asked to look at the issues that drive us to make the decisions we make, many of which come to us through fear, bullying, uncertainty, and a lack of knowledge, and to perhaps think alternatively about how illnesses occur and disappear.

For more information about Dr. Palevsky,  please visit www.drpalevsky.com
results.name: Are Vaccines Safe and Effective? (Ticket per Couple)

results.description:
A general Toastmasters club meeting has three parts: a) Project Speeches; b) Table Topics;  and c). Evaluation. 

a).  The first part is Project Speeches. Our Project Speakers get their project assignments from either the Competent Communicationmanual or one of the Advanced Communication manuals. The Project Speakers prepare their speeches according to the project assignment.

b).  The second part of the meeting is Table Topics, which are brief impromptu speeches that require no preparation.  There are two purposes during this part.  The first purpose is to provide a speaking opportunity to members and prospective members who do not have a speaking role. The second purpose is to improve our impromptu speaking skills.

c).  The third and final part of the meeting is the Evaluation portion. Evaluation is an important part of a Toastmasters meeting. Unless we receive feedback on our speeches to know what our strengths and weaknesses are, we will not improve our communication and listening skills.

In the club meeting, you practice giving prepared speeches as well as brief impromptu presentations (Table Topics). There is no rush and no pressure: The Toastmasters program allows you to progress at your own pace.

Constructive evaluation is central to the Toastmasters philosophy. Receiving - and giving - such feedback is a great learning experience. In Toastmasters, encouragement and improvement go hand-in-hand.

Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.
results.name: Toastmasters Club Meeting

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS

Post pictures and videos at:

results.description:
To celebrate 4 years of NBCBC we're looping back to where we started. We'll be revisiting the work of Jeff Lemire, who wrote the first books we read, Sweet Tooth. (Quite ambitious of us to read 4 books in 1 month! We're not doing that again. I promise.)

Next up: The Nobody

The tiny, isolated fishing village of Large Mouth never saw much excitement -- until the arrival of the stranger, that is. Wrapped from head to toe in bandages and wearing weird goggles, he quietly took up residence in the sleepy town's motel.Driven by curiosity, the townfolk quickly learn the tragic story of his past, and of the terrible accident that left him horribly disfigured. Eventually, the town embraces the stranger as one of their own -- but do his bandages hide more than just scars?
results.name: NBCBC #48: The Nobody by Jeff Lemire

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun Intimacy and communcation games and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 7:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.

results.description:
Full info at:  one.kabbalah.info

Over 500 students and people who are interested in the wisdom of Kabbalah from North America and around the world are gathering for a powerful 3-day event. Through the wisdom of Kabbalah, we will be able to reveal a complete, eternal and inner reality together, existing above the limitations of time and place, and tend to the diverse global problems being revealed to us in the 21st century.

Take a good look at the world around you.
It’s going to look very different after this.

We will move together from lessons with Dr Laitman, to musical gatherings on the lawn, festive meals, connection activities, Kabbalistic Yeshivat Haverim and work in circles of ten. Sitting in a workshop with nine other Friends, each participant gets to engage in an inner dialogue with the Upper Force, which is revealed in the center of the group of ten.

Like the 10 writers of the Zohar who gathered to compose their book, we too will gather to write our own story of spiritual ascent.

Once a year we have this special opportunity to gather from around the world to establish the internal network of ten among us, to meet our teacher, Dr. Laitman, and our instructors from the Education Center, and to receive a spiritual boost one can’t get anywhere but live at the convention.

This event could change your life.

For registration, schedule, music, and all other information, go to:  one.kabbalah.info

Contact info for any questions or help with registration:

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript through intuitive lectures and pair-programming 

In JavaScript the Hard Parts, we cover callbacks, higher-order functions (functional programming with JavaScript), object-oriented programming with JavaScript, closure, scope and execution context

This week we continue our mini-series: Javascript - The Hard Parts. We will cover closure, scope, and execution context - one of the toughest concepts in Javascript.

This includes how to handle or recreate the functions:

• map • reduce • forEach This is a concept that 80% of JavaScript engineers do not understand but are at the core of every single successful application

This is possible because we'll understand the essence of these tough concepts and then switch into pair-programming through the challenges to cement the concepts

The evening session is comprised of: 


10:00 - 10:15pm: Meet your future pair programming partner. 

10:15 - 10:45pm: Core JavaScript concept for the challenge and introduction to the secret hack for learning to code - pair-programming. 

10:45 - 11:30pm: Pair-programming.

Bring a friend who'd like to build and you can pair program together. 

Price: Always free
results.name: JavaScript the Hard Parts: Closure, Scope & Execution Context @Online

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.

It's time for us to visit the world's most historically rich and politically charged nation in the Universe! Are you ready for Israel? You've read the Bible, and now it's time to go to all the places that we've seen on its pages. Join a group of amazing New Yorkers from the Brooklyn Ark for an 8-day tour through the country, including:


Jerusalem
Temple Mount & Dome on the Rock
Wailing Wall
Mount of Olives
Garden of Gethsemane
Masada Mountain Fortress
Yad Vashem Holocaust Museum
The Temple Institute
Dead Sea
Sea of Galilee/Kinneret
Jordan River
Capernaum
Nazareth
Mount Arbel
Sodom & Gomorrah
Valley of Armageddon
Tel Aviv
Tomb of Maimonides (Rambam)
And More 


We are currently estimating the price for the trip to be at ~$1999, including the flight, breakfasts, transportation around Israel, access to sites, and accommodations. As for the dates, the trip will take place in late May of 2016 (over parts of the third and fourth weeks of the month). The exact dates will be determined by flight availability and will be set in stone in December. Deposit #1: $1000 (nonrefundable) is due by Sunday, November 29th, 2015. Deposit #2: $999 (nonrefundable) is due by Sunday, April 3rd, 2016. All deposits can be paid through the Brooklyn Ark Give Page with the payments noted toward "Israel Trip - May 2016."

This is going to be an experience you'll never forget!

Learn more about the Brooklyn Ark & our Community.

results.description:
Friends, Eli and Carrie here! We're very excited to officially announce the premier trip of our new project, SHVILEI OLAM. We would love to hear your thoughts, and, if you're free the weekend of May 20-22, apply and join us! Please pass this along to anyone who might be interested.

WHEN: May 20-22, 2016 - Leaving 7am from Temple Beth Shalom, Cambridge and driving up to the White Mountains in New Hampshire.

WHAT: A new organization, SHVILEI OLAM, is hosting a Backcountry Shabbaton. We are currently accepting applications from 20s/30s interested in experiencing the celebration of a traditional Shabbat in the woods. We'll be learning backpacking skills, building our own halakhic eruv, identifying stars, dabbling in the spiritual practice of hitboddetut, and much more!

WHO WE ARE: We are Eli Witkin and Carrie Watkins, two observant adventurers with a mission of enhancing Jewish practices through nature. We built this one of a kind Shabbaton to help others learn basic outdoor skills, and, in doing so, gain a deeper appreciation of our tradition. It is our hope that participants will walk away from the program with an enhanced connection with the natural world and illuminated understanding of the context from which many of our Shabbat observances stem.

HOW MUCH: This trip is funded by a generous grant from the CJP and co-sponsored by Temple Beth Shalom of Cambridge. While participants are required to bring some supplies (comprehensive packing list will be provided), the cost of the trip is FREE. Please complete your application no later than APRIL 15

QUESTIONS: email [masked]
results.name: Camping Shabaton in the Woods!

Join us as we help kick off the inaugural Propeller Festival (http://propellerfest.com/letspropel), a full day of innovation, education, and inspiration. 

TICKETS ARE REQUIRED to attend. GET TICKETS AT http://bit.ly/PropellerFest. 

Use code"CMM1" at checkout for a 50% discount.

_____________________________________________________

Propeller Fest will bring together over 2,000+ entrepreneurs, innovators, influencers, marketers, designers, and investors from all over the Northeast region. The full day program will include 70+ speakers , 50+ exhibitors, drone and virtual reality demos, a startup competition, VC conversations, food trucks, and live music performances in the evening.

CONFIRMED SPEAKERS include:


• Gary Vaynerchuk (CEO, Entrepreneur, Investor, Best-Selling Author)

• James Altucher (Author, Investor, Entrepreneur)

• Marcus Weldon (President & CEO, Bell Labs)

• Jenny Fielding (Managing Director, Techstars)

• Nsi Obotetukudo (Cofounder & COO, Alley)

• Bruce Weed (Watson, Big Data, IoT, Cloud, IBM)

• Anthony Frasier (Founder, Phat Startup, Tech808)

• Amy Andrieux (Global Editor ,Communications Project, Manager, Red Bull Studios)

• Chike Ukaegbu (Lead Executive, Startup52)

• Judith Spitz (EIR, Cornell Tech; Former CIO, Verizon)

CONVERSATIONS on:

• FUTURE OF: Music, Work, eCommerce, Content, Fintech, Corporate Education, Virtual Reality, HR, Marketing

• STARTUPS: Fundraising, Product, Entrepreneurship, User Acquisition, Recruiting, Imposter Syndrome,Pitching

• CORPORATE INNOVATION: Strategic Partners, Intraprenuership, Think Tanks, Acting Like A Startup, Investing Innovation

MUSICAL PERFORMANCES by:


• Beatie Wolf

• The Human Digital orchestra

• The Naked and Famous

_____________________________________________________


Hope to see many of you there! - Kofi

results.description:
Tentative Plan. Friday through Sunday May 20 - 22, 2016.

Depending on the weather this Winter/Spring, the expected arrival of Black Fly Season may necessitate a change of date.

We will Arrive Friday morning and paddle out to one of the
9 designated campsites that surround the flow. We'll spend 2 nights at camp. The days can be spend paddling, fishing, and exploring the flow.  More information to follow.

I have added some information regarding the Cedar River Flow from the website AndyArthur.org.

The Cedar River Flow is a remote 640-acre (2.6 km2) shallow lake, created by the Wakely Dam, where there are 10 campsites accessible via a gravel road, 14 miles (23 km) from Indian Lake or 23 miles (37 km) from Inlet. This area is also known as the Cedar River Entrance, and beyond it is the 150 campsites of Moose River Plains.

More campsites are accessible via canoe, around the Flow. It lies on the border between the Moose River Plains Wild Forest and the West Canada Lake Wilderness Area.

You can paddle up the Cedar River, above Cedar River Flow to the first Lean-To. Shortly thereafter, water levels are too low for paddling

results.name: Suggested Event: Propeller Innovation Festival

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER THROUGH www.propellerfest.com TO ATTEND. RSVPng HERE DOES NOT GET YOU ENTRANCE TO THE EVENT.

Hi Everyone! 


Morris Tech Meetup has officially joined Propeller as a Community Partner, and we’re proud to share the official launch of Propeller, a unique technology and music event, to be held May 20th at Pier A in Hoboken. Propeller’s official mission is to unite innovators to celebrate what's new and create what's next with inspiration, education, and fun. 

Propeller embodies the reality that ideas are a dime a dozen; what matters is that you propel yourself, your ideas, and your team, forward. Put more eloquently: Idle Ideas Don't Fly. YOU are the inspiration for this event. Because you are members of Morris Tech Meetup, you are the first to have access to the event’s Super Early Adopter Pricing. Use code morristech15 for an additional $15 off. Hurry, this group code is set to expire soon. 

Your ticket does not just get you into Propeller. Besides access to the event itself, each ticket provides over $1000 in value including a month-long coworking pass to both the Alley in NYC and Mission 50 in Hoboken, a free Audible book download, a subscription to Entrepreneur Magazine, a 1-hour coaching session from a live Entrepreneur Magazine Coach, $5 off Jet.com, and more. Below are some event highlights to look forward to:

Between the Stage of Inspiration and the Stage of Wisdom, the event will feature 20+ amazing speakers including: Author, James Altucher / CTO of Nokia, Marcus Weldon / Investor, Joanne Wilson / Jet Founder, Marc Lore, / CTO of NYC, Minerva Tantoco / CNBC Anchor, Wilfred Frost / Bionic Founder, David Kidder / DigitalOcean Cofounder, Mitch Wainer / Elite Daily, Cofounder Gerard Adams / HARO Founder, Peter Shankman, among others. During the day, there will also be a drone competition, virtual reality experiences from Stevens & Audible, a startup competition co-hosted by Techstars and Newark Venture partners, the Alley Lounge, the Jet Bar & Lounge, and VC Speed Dating. There will also be exhibitors from small to growth to enterprise companies, startup demos at the Hello & Demo Bar, and many more immersive interactive experiences like the Bell Labs Human Digital Orchestra. Very shortly, the Propeller team will announce the musical artist performing at the conclusion of the event, so stay tuned!

Propeller has superior involvement from sponsors including Bell Labs, Alley, Audible, IBM, Red Bull, Jet, Uber, Rockefeller Group, Newark Venture Partners, EisnerAmper, McCarter & English, and WithumSmith & Brown. Entrepreneur Magazine will be serving as the event’s official media partner. Propeller is where the innovators of the Northeast unite. Join us! #LetsPropel. Buy your ticket now. 

Very sincerely, Morris Tech Meetup 

Want to sponsor or exhibit? Contact [masked]. 

Tweet the following and help spread the word: 

Buckle up! @PropellerFest takes flight! Checkout this NYC event on 5/20: Drones, VR, Keynotes, Startups, +Concert www.propellerfest.com 

Hoboken to host entire NYC innovation community. No more rhymes for @APstartup. Now startups, keynotes, vr & concert! www.propellerfest.com

results.description:
Hi Meetup friends! We've got a hands-on visual skills for design thinking workshop coming up next week on Friday 5/20. No prior art or sketching skills required! Get your ticket here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sketching-bootcamp-visual-skills-for-design-thinking-tickets-22473594125

Sketching Bootcamp: Visual Skills for Design Thinking

Sketching is the fastest way to convey ideas and bring a team into alignment. Whether you’re in an ideation session, cranking on prototypes, or taking notes during a meeting, being comfortable with a marker in your hand is a skill that will help you become a better design thinker. Regardless of your role in your organization or on a project, being able to define concepts through visuals is a valuable skill that can help boost your creativity.

In this workshop you will take your visual skills to the next level through activities and practice with tools and methods for sketch noting, visual facilitation, and conveying meaning with simple icons and shapes. 

We’ll cover four key categories of skills:


1. VISUAL VOCABULARY

In language we use the alphabet, in visualization there are basic forms to sketch representing people, places, actions or how time has lapsed. Having a larger visual vocabulary means not having to think about what you’re drawing, but focusing on what you want to convey.

2. PROCESS MAPPING

When we’re conveying ideas, the small concepts mentioned above add up to make a story. This story could tell how produce moves from the farm to our table or how cash flows through an organization. Understanding how to put the small pieces together to paint a grander picture is important for systems thinking and strategy.

3. FRAMEWORKS

Flowcharts, pyramid diagrams, bulls-eyes, journey maps…there’s no reason to reinvent the wheel when so many frameworks already exist. Having a good understanding of each type of visual framework and what it does will help you quickly express ideas for yourself and to your team.

4. SUMMARIZING AND PRESENTING DATA

As we start to build confidence in our visual vocabulary, mapping abilities, and have multiple frameworks to choose from, we can now start putting all of these components together. We’ll integrate quantitative and qualitative data into our sketches to sell an idea that helps move an audience to action.
results.name: Visual Skills for Design Thinking

group.name: The Design Gym New York City

results.description:
Hello Fam!


This week we have the pleasure of having Kat Vorotova of Try the World coming by to share her journey.

Try The World is a global online marketplace for authentic products from around the world. Built around an engaged community with exclusive food, travel and cultural content, Try The World curates subscription and gift boxes with gourmet foods from dozens of countries selected by celebrity chefs. Many of these delicious, authentic and hard-to-find products are also exclusively available for individual purchase on Try The World's online Shop. 

Try The World was founded in 2013 by Kat Vorotova, a New York foodie born in Russia and former strategy consultant, and David Foult, a French globetrotter and serial entrepreneur. They met in New York while studying at Columbia University and the company grew out of their passion for traveling and discovering great food and new cultures. 

Now a team of 30 based in NYC, the venture backed company has been featured in the WSJ, Forbes, CNN and more. You may have also seen their ads on the New York subway or even stopped by their pop-up shop in the Lower East Side!

We'll get a chance to hear her journey plus Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

Future events: 

** Office hours with Rubicon VC - Every Tuesday Morning 

5/20 - Propeller Fest 

**Sign up now here: http://www.propellerfest.com/

DISCOUNT CODE: CMM3 for a 50% discount.

6/3 - Rodney Gibson (Oscar) 

6/10 - Mary Liu (BDMI)

6/17 - Seth Melnick (Lyft)

This game has a fee ($3 outdoor; $5 indoor).

100% of game fees go to the the NYISL.com - a non-profit soccer league for under-funded and under-served public schools.

See the below video for more info. about our non-profit schools league " unselectable="on">

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fees to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee for one to several weeks (depending how much you donate)!

results.description:
We had a wonderful meetup last week at Cooper Hewitt so let's do it again.

The Arthur Ross Terrace and Garden is now open to the public following a redesign by Hood Design Studio, in collaboration with RAFT Landscape Architecture and Diller Scofidio + Renfro. The revamped garden features new terrace pavers, garden pathways, plantings, a reimagined rock garden, and a transformed northwest garden. 

The garden is open to the public free of charge starting at 8 a.m. on weekdays and 10 a.m. on weekends.  Visitor entry through the museum’s 90th Street entrance featuring a striking canopy designed by Diller Scofidio + Renfro

Plan to bring a blanket or sheet and some toys as we enjoy a relaxing meetup at this outdoor space.  There is a small cafe that serves coffee and sandwiches.

results.description:
De-stress and recharge during this hour-long session.  Practice simple, effective methods (including Tai Chi, Qigong and Meditation) to clear the mind and loosen the body, then relax afterward to receive the benefits of your practice.  This session is specifically designed to help busy people integrate tools for relaxation into their lives.  

Companies such as Google and Aetna have implemented mindfulness courses with great results, with employees reporting less stress, increased clarity of mind and improved quality of life.


Please wear comfortable clothes that you can easily sit or lie down, as there will be time at the end of practice to lie down and relax.  We recommend that you have a light snack up to 30 minutes before the session and then have lunch afterward.

results.description:
TAKE NOTE: This is a strenuous hike and not for beginners. You must have some backpacking experience and have done day hikes of 15-miles with at least 4,000 ft elevation gain. 

Difficulty: Strenuous 
Distance: 32 miles 
Vertical Gain: around 10,000 ft 
Estimated Time: 2.5 days 


The Pemi Loop affords eight wide-open summits on the New Hampshire 48 list of 4,000+ footers—each offering spectacular views of the Pemigewasset Wilderness—plus four other “optional” 4,000+ peaks on the list bagged via short side trails.

http://caltopo.com/m/5F23

We are backpacking the pemi-loop starting on Friday afternoon and ending on Sunday. Doing this in 2.5 days allows us to hike the whole trail and have more time to enjoy the wilderness. We will hike the loop in a counter-clockwise direction. The hike starts and ends at the Lincoln Woods Trailhead.

View map...

View image...

View elevation/topo profile...

** TAKE NOTE: This is our first time to hike/backpack the full loop. We will firm up the finer details of the hike over the week.


Liability Waiver:


Outdoor recreation activities are by their very nature potentially hazardous and contain risk. All participants in such activities must assume the responsibility for their own actions and safety. The outdoors are forever changing. No book can replace good judgment. The organizer cannot be held responsible for inaccuracies, errors or omissions or for changes in the details in this hike or for the consequences of any reliance on the information contained herein or for the safety of people in the outdoors.
results.name: Pemi Loop Backpacking

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Three distinct neighborhoods in Manhattan with unique beats yet connected in proximity and creativity. Come explore SoHo’s architectural treasures and learn of its art, shopping, culture and more. We will also experience how Italians have shaped  the most iconic Italian enclave in the U.S. We then later finish exploring sections on the largest Chinatown in North America.

Itinerary: 
• SoHo’s Cast-Iron District 
• Richard Haas Mural on Spring St. 
• Haughwout Building 
• The Italian American Museum 
• Church of the Most Precious Blood 
• Mahayana Buddhist Temple 
• Columbus Park 
• And More

Experience a cultural patrimony that will connect you to sections of New York and also the world.

Reservations: 
RSVPs are required. If later you realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation. If you RSVP and fail to attend without notice you will not be able to make future reservations. 

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on 103 Prince St. map here (Prince St. side). Tour concludes at Columbus Park map here.

Cost: 
$20 per person. Paid on the day of the tour. Cash only. **Special Offer: If this is the first tour you are participating in you get to name the price at the end in the form of a gratuity.**

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

----

Arrive at 5:45pm if you want to do some improv warmups.  The jam will start right at 6pm sharp!

----

Please, no outside food or water of any kind, including water bottles.  The Triple Crown offers food and drink discounts for those with this improv show.  They offer 10% off food, and $4 select draft beers.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
Here it is…Our first meet up for 2016 and with your new organizer.  I am in the process of putting together a wonderful agenda for everyone.  We will have some great presenters at our fantastic new location thanks to our wonderful venue sponsor Microsoft. 

The first half hour will be networking so please bring plenty of business cards.  Stay tuned for more details and spread the word to anyone interested in attending.

Note: Refreshments will be served.  I am working on getting us a sponsor for this.

Also, please note we still need at least one group member to present so if you are working on a project and you would like to present to the group or you want to let us know what you do please contact me.  I look forward to seeing everyone there.

Speakers - Update

USPTO

We will have Kristen Matter from USPTO (United States Patent and Trademark Office).  She will be discussing the patent and trademark process. This is very important even in technology as you create new products and processes; remember you must protect your intellectual property.  

American Express® Open Forum

We will have a team of speakers from the American Express® Open Forum.  American Express® OPEN Forum is an online resource that provides insights, inspiration, and connections with other small business owners to help grow your business.  You can find exclusive guides, articles, videos from experts like Guy Kawasaki, as well as MSNBC’s Your Business, General Assembly, and more. Learn more at openforum.com.

Tobias Wright from Condé Nast

Technology is Tobias Wright's vocation and avocation. He has had lifelong passion for making things since running his first programs in BASIC. Presently, he is a ‎Senior Software Engineer at Condé Nast and an adviser to Digitalundivided (DID).

results.description:
GODS AND MORTALS AT OLYMPUS: ANCIENT DION, CITY OF ZEUS at the Onassis Foundation features never-before-seen ancient artworks side-by-side with contemporary works – and Museum Hack has hacked the exhibition for your pleasure!

Come see these amazing artworks, learn all the insane stories about the gods and life as an ancient Greek in 200 BCE, and be led around by one of our renegade tour guides, who will customize the experience based on YOU!

Want to hear more about Zeus? You got it. Can't get enough of mosaics? We've got you covered.

We are offering free 1-hour tours on five upcoming
Friday evenings, from 6-7 pm and 7-8 pm:

April 15th
May 6th
May 20th
June 3rd
June 17th

To reserve your spot, please RSVP here on Meetup and register at https://onassismuseumhack.splashthat.com/
results.name: Free Museum Hack Tour: GODS AND MORTALS AT OLYMPUS

group.name: Fun Networking for HR & Young Professionals in NYC

results.description:
Feeling a little discouraged about the future of Liberty? Let NYCIR give you a reason to persevere and fight for freedom. Continue to learn about the importance of local politics in laying the groundwork for the future. Joe C. will show you how surprisingly easy it is to get on a NYC ballot and strategize where we can make a difference. 

Then, Dahrla will lead a brief discussion on democracy v. republicanism, examining what the founders meant in Article 4, guaranteeing all states a republican form of government. Does the Every Vote Equal movement undermine or enhance this guarantee? 

(Please note that our group employs the word ‘Republican’ in the classical Roman and Madisonian context and not in reference to the Party of Lincoln or its GOP namesake) 

Venue: Simple Studios. Centrally located near Penn and major Red and Blue lines. 
  
Catering: Pick-up on your way here or have it delivered. List of great takeout spots on the block will be posted. There's a beverage stand and vending machine on site. 


Program Highlights:

6 - 7pm : Meet‘n’Greet + Ice Breaker Segment
Discover our growing community of Free Thinkers, Ex-Liberals and Freedom Lovers. Make new friends and catch up with current ones. 

7 - 8pm : Indie R. Talks
Four bite size segments that will inform, educate and inspire you. Feel free to eat and drink during this time. We're doing this casual, dinner theater style with frequent breaks. 

• Insider News Bulletin: Plots, scandals, arrests and local races. Get the inside scoop on what NY's state and local power brokers are up to.  
• The ABCs of NYC Politics: The road to Liberty begins with an aerial view of local election laws and voter demographics. 
• First Principles + Constitution Series: Democracy vs Republicanism. Article 4 Section 4. And why it matters to you. 
• Q&A: Your opportunity to ask questions and discuss the presented items. 

8 - 8.30pm : Continue Meet‘n’Greet

8.30 - 9pm : Evening Wrap-up. Exchange business cards, emails and best wishes.
results.how_to_find_us: Room 211. Off the elevator and to your left. Second studio.
results.name: Spring Meet‘n’Greet + Learn Liberty/NYC Politics Series

At this upscale penthouse/rooftop mixer, you’ll have the chance to meet 200+ professional singles for an evening of mixing, mingling and merriment!

Every time we host a Meetup at the famous & elegant Hudson Terrace it sells out, so please get your ticket ASAP.  

*Prepay Only Event. NO tickets sold at door. 

GET TICKETS HERE

What to expect:

• Free Open Well Bar (6-7pm) 

• Complimentary Appetizers

• Ice Breakers & Prizes

• Top 40 & Hip Hop all-night

• 200+ singles (21-49) 

Admission:

*50% off limited tickets available for $20 ($40 otherwise) 

*MUST PREPAY HERE 

How many will be attending? Several groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending. 200+ will be in attendance like all our past events at Hudson Terrace.

Is this event private? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests.

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends, either way you'll have a great time.

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, sweats, hats. Jeans ok. 

*GET TIX HERE ($20) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudsonterrace/dates/May-20-2016_at_0600PM

*(Only 20 available at this price, goes up as event gets closer)

results.description:
We meet at NYC Guitar School,

251 w 30th St on the 7th Floor (no longer 8th floor)

Check out some videos here:

"Rock Me Baby"

https://vine.co/v/MMOvEWDJTmM

https://vine.co/v/M5L7rPrJdzp

"Bad To The Bone"

https://vine.co/v/h26I1j3J0v7

Blues Jam

"

https://vine.co/v/h26XTIzVWeH

"

For beginners and intermediate players. (We are a very supportive crowd!)

We will warm up by strumming along to great songs then go over blues licks and jam!

BYOB Jam; Hang Out, Drink and Play!

Blues Jam Made Easy; work on pentatonic scales and seventh chords.

This will be a guided blues jam with room for improvement on all levels of playing.

Acoustic guitars are provided. There are a few amps for electric guitars if you bring yours.

Bass players are welcome (bring your own bass)

Ukelele players are welcome (bring your own uke)
results.name: Happy Hour Guitar BYOB Jam

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Let's Get Social and Have FUN = True BLISS!!

We're mixing it up and hanging out at the very cool, Cafe' Serai in the Rubin Museum of Art. The energy of the Bliss seekers who show up fully, mixed with the energy of the Rubin are worth the visit. So inspiring!!! Great way to turn around a stressful week, celebrate a joyful one and make new friends!

COME FOR PART OR ALL OF THE EVENING!

This is one of my VERY FAVORITE places to gather in NYC.
If you have never been you will love it:
* The food is yummy-eclectic
* Happy hour = 2:1 house drinks, 6:00 - 7:00 pm
* There's a DJ (music, not dance)
* Museum is FREE on Fridays (tour @ 7pm) with an awesome collection of Himalayan and Nepalese art, and spirit-inspiring spaces (like the Tibetan Shrine room exhibit.

Check out the website to learn more about the activities: http://www.rubinmuseum.org
NOTE: Fridays are busy, so come early and get your food & drinks.

NATURAL NETWORKING: It is well known that people hire you because they "know, like and trust" you. In this atmosphere, it is easy to relax, be yourself and authentically attractive. This is about personal connection! Try to avoid the dreaded & boring "what do you do?" question. How about, "What's your passion?" to get a real conversation started, and find out how/if you and the other person resonate.

Come to have FUN, but bring your business cards in case someone wants to connect with you or learn more about you and what you bring to the world by way of your business. Many profitable connections have already grown from these events, e.g., new clients, great resources, support networking and much more.

It's great to mix business with retreat & mindfulness. Playtime is key to creativity and productivity. It's also a great way to nurture natural networking & nurture creative soul.

I look forward to meeting you for the first time, reconnecting and enjoying food, fun and drinks (alcoholic or non)

From my heart to yours,
results.name: [Social Bliss] Fun & Fabulous Evening Mixer (Natural Networking) FREE

group.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!


Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.
results.how_to_find_us: we'll have some signs out at the tables on the upper level
results.name: Holistic Hangout @ Whole Foods Cafe - Houston St
