results.description:
After a long hiatus we are finally ready to get things rolling! Please join us for a public health professionals mixer! This will be a great opportunity to sip happy hour drinks, meet new people, and discover what other people are doing in the public health field. We will provide a fun and interactive conversation started to help break the ice.

Bring your business card to be entered to win a $10 Amazon e-gift card!
results.how_to_find_us: Brooklyn, NY on Fulton Street (Near Atlantic Ave.)
results.name: Public Health Mixer!

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
In his seminal book, Progress and Poverty, Henry George clearly showed that society’s enormous power to produce wealth was not a cause of recessions and depressions. Why, 137 years later, with even better technology, do we still have unemployment, homelessness, and low wages?

Insights in the acclaimed documentary “Boom Bust, Boom” by Terry Jones will help us explore the nature of the business cycle and consider strategies to make the economy work for everyone. Thanks to the team at www.boombustclick.com for facilitating this seminar. Please visit their web site to learn more about the film and the global movement to democratize economics.
results.name: Why does our economy go Boom Bust Boom?

group.name: Progress and Prosperity, Land and Liberty – New York City

results.description: BSSCo is a totally groovy and unique non-profit that sells "superhero supplies" and other zany merchandise in order to raise awareness of/profits for the free academic tutoring and creative writing workshops they provide for young people! In this event, individuals with lived experience of mental health issues/extreme states will be coming together to help BSSCo assemble and package merchandise while simultaneously creating a private safe-space where people can talk freely about their experiences with mental health issues/extreme states (or anything else they feel like talking about). The group will end with a mini-gift circle where individuals will have an opportunity to request and offer specific acts of support (ex: "I have this great book on meditation if anyone wants to borrow it", "I am looking for a running partner who lives in my neighborhood", etc...). Should be a fun and positive time!
results.how_to_find_us: We will most likely be in the back area, which is through the door that's disguised as a shelf. If you have trouble finding us, tell someone who works there you are looking for "Josh's maker's shift".
results.name: Let's help out The Brooklyn Superhero Supply Company! (MH issues/extreme states)

results.description:
It's a multilingual happy hour! Join Argot for drinks and conversation in all languages. Grab some unlimited wine/beer, meet locals and internationals, expand your community in NYC, and learn to speak your favorite foreign language like a local! All languages welcome! We'll provide wine, beer, snacks, and games to break the ice and guarantee a great evening!

Registration required here on our website!!!!!


$15 for adults 21 & over (beer & wine included)
$8 for students under 21
results.name: All Languages Happy Hour!!

group.name: Argot NYC • Multilingual Happy Hour • Drinks & Conversation

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

This will be our 4th time at Vapiano, after the great success of our February, March, & April meetups! Sorry for the late announcement, I hope to see many of you anyways!!!

Vapiano is close to Union Square for easy transportation, has individual payment system to avoid shared checks, a large space to accommodate large group and a very low music level for conversations. Plus, they have plenty of food should you come hungry.

NOTE: You will receive a plastic card upon entering, which you use to place all your orders at the bar or counter. At the end of the night you pay off your card as you exit the place.

Is there a Cover Charge?

No! Our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

Do I have to speak German?

No. While many are German natives who will speak German, our conversations are usually mixed depending on your skills and preferences.

How long is the event?

Vapiano closes at Midnight. During past events many of our members stayed until closing, some went out clubbing afterwards, but there is no official end time. If you like to stay, you stay. If you need to head out early or just wanna stop by and say hi, that is totally fine. On the flipside, of course, there is no guarantee that we will stay till closing. Depends on how the night is going :)

How do I get there by train?

4/5/6/N/R/Q/L -  Union Square: 1-3 blocks

F/M - 14th St: 3 blocks

A/C/E/B/D - West 4th St: 10 blocks or tranfser to F/M to 14th St

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

I am looking forward to see plenty of you guys again, as well as many new members & guests!!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
For our Spring/Summer sessions, we shall revert back to 3 Teams.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, 6 outfield players, NO sub, and a goal keeper.

• We play for 8 minutes or 2 goals.

• Winner stays! 

• If the initial game between the first 2 teams ends in a tie, a coin toss will be used to determine which team stays on.

• In the event of a tie, the new or incoming team stays on.

• Be Social, use your time on the sideline to get to know your teammates better :))


• We now play with 3 different practice jerseys. RED uptown logo bibs, LIME GREEN, and BLUE bibs.  

• We will provide clean freshly laundered bibs for every game. However, to encourage a sense of community and keep cost low, we encourage members to take the bibs they've worn for the game home, wash and please return back to us. 


Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
Please check meetup site for any cancellations or changes due to weather.

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

Comments
活动收取门票$5每人，请准备现金，最好有零钱。在入场时找David Gao交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间5月20日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开2-3桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

results.description:
Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553

This is one of our most popular Meetups... We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

* THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THIS EVENT IS BEING LISTED ON OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL EVENT ATTENDEES.

"Mingle & Taste Wines From All Around The World!"
Join us for a festive Wine tasting and mingle with fellow upscale NYC professionals where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. There will be red and white wines for all around the world along with delicious cheeses. Detailed instructions on how the wine was made with each pour!. Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Expect more than 25 people (mostly singles) to attend. This is not an age specific event. Anyone friendly and interested in mingling and tasting great wine may attend.

Also enjoy complimentary cheeses & crudités!

When: Friday, May 20th: 6:30 - 8:30 PM (You can arrive as early as 6:20 to check-in)
Where: "Some Good Wine" (13 E 8th St, New York, NY - between 5th Ave and University Pl)

POST WINE TASTING MINGLE! After the wine tasting ends we will be inviting all attendees to stroll down the street to a nearby bar so we can continue to mingle. We will be announcing the venue where this will be held during the wine tasting event.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553

FAQ:

How many people will be attending? We usually have between 25 and 40 people at this event.

What us the dress code? The dress code is "neat, casual or trendy". Basically just don't wear gym attire. What you wear to work is likely perfect.

Can I come alone? Yes 75% attending typically come on their own... some people bring a friend or 2.

Is this event social? Yes! What makes this event great is that a lot of socializing goes on and the vibe is very laid back and friendly.

Do I need to know about wine? Absolutely not... Most come to learn and to socialize.

What is the age range? This is not for a specific age range. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang out and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this event will sell out so grab your ticket as early as possible.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553


We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

results.description:
The Catholic Fellowship of NYC and WeekendDating.com have teamed up together to bring hundreds of singles for this very special Spring Fling Catholic Singles Mingle Fundraiser benefiting Food for the Poor.  

Over 200 singles attended our previous singles mingle charity event. 

Enjoy:

* Ice breaker games to get you mingling with other fun singles
* Great party music (at a sensible noise level)
* Prize giveaways
* Cash Bar - Drink Specials

Cost:
$15.75 on/before 5/13
$[masked]/14- 5/19 
$20.00 on 5/20 (online and at the door)

To purchase tickets online (CLICK HERE) TO BUY  A TICKET

venue.name: Some Good Wine

results.description:
This is one of our most popular Meetups... We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

* THIS IS NOT A JEWISH SPECIFIC EVENT.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553

* THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THIS EVENT IS BEING LISTED ON OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL EVENT ATTENDEES.

"Mingle & Taste Wines From All Around The World!"
Join us for a festive Wine tasting and mingle with fellow upscale NYC professionals where you will get to taste a wide variety of wines in a fun, relaxed environment. There will be red and white wines for all around the world along with delicious cheeses. Detailed instructions on how the wine was made with each pour!. Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Expect more than 25 people (mostly singles) to attend. This is not an age specific event. Anyone friendly and interested in mingling and tasting great wine may attend.

Also enjoy complimentary cheeses & crudités!

When: Friday, May 20th: 6:30 - 8:30 PM (You can arrive as early as 6:20 to check-in)
Where: "Some Good Wine" (13 E 8th St, New York, NY - between 5th Ave and University Pl)

POST WINE TASTING MINGLE! After the wine tasting ends we will be inviting all attendees to stroll down the street to a nearby bar so we can continue to mingle. We will be announcing the venue where this will be held during the wine tasting event.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553

FAQ:

How many people will be attending? We usually have between 25 and 40 people at this event.

What us the dress code? The dress code is "neat, casual or trendy". Basically just don't wear gym attire. What you wear to work is likely perfect.

Can I come alone? Yes 75% attending typically come on their own... some people bring a friend or 2.

Is this event social? Yes! What makes this event great is that a lot of socializing goes on and the vibe is very laid back and friendly.

Do I need to know about wine? Absolutely not... Most come to learn and to socialize.

What is the age range? This is not for a specific age range. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang out and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this event will sell out so grab your ticket as early as possible.

Get Tickets At: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-event-tickets-25433924553


We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.
results.name: Wine Tasting Event - Wines, Cheeses & Mingle (Online PrePay Required)

*

Friday, May 20

*

Merengue Dance Instruction

Registration 6:30pm - Instruction 7pm - 8pm (optional)

Meet and Greet7:15pm

Friday Dance Party & Social8pm to Midnight

Essex County 

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

click venue name above for directions

111 Prospect Avenue West Orange, NJ 07052

* 

The Place to be Seen!

 Over 150 are expected

* 

THE EVENT

*

Merengue Dance Instruction(optional)

by Leslie

Registration 6:30pm --- Instruction 7:00pm - 8:00pm

Over 30 individuals at the dance instruction, a great icebreaker as you change partners! Meet 120 more happy faces at the Dance and Social.

No partner needed. Tonight's class is for Beginner and Intermediate level dancers. Accomplished dancers are always welcome to polish their skills and to meet new faces..

*

Friday Dance Party & Social

8:00pm to Midnight.

"Mix, Mingle and Dance" in The Dôme Nightclub. PBSN's DJ will be taking requests and spinning the hottest dance tracks all night long! You just might meet that special person! .

Everyone welcome, expected median Age 55. Introduce your friends to PBSN tonight in an elegant and sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere.

*

Cash bar. Sip a thirst quenching drink and dance the night away with new friends!

*

No reservation is required.

Singles, Couples, Groups, Guests, Friends, and Walk-ins are always welcome.

Membership is not required.

*

PROPER ATTIRE

Dress to Impress.

The Manor requests business attire, jackets are preferred. Please, no jeans, no sneakers, no shorts, no t-shirts.

*

COST

*

$20 admission at the door

...OR...

Encourage your Friends and Guests to Sign Up

$15 admission at the door before 8:00pm for each person who sends a Sign Up email to [masked] See Sign Up Information below.

...OR...

$13 by 5/19, $20 after 5/19 with purchase of tickets thru Eventbrite<--- Click here for details ... Eventbrite tickets are good for admission at any time during this event.

*

( All admission fees include attending optional Instruction, Meet & Greet and Dance )

The Dôme, originally designed for but never integrated into the White House during the Benjamin Harrison administration [masked]), was adapted for The Manor and added to the West Orange landmark in 1975. 

*

Experience the grandeur of the new two story foyer and spiral Stairway on your way up to the Dôme Nightclub

results.description:
Snacks and beverages will be served.

Is it high time you pressed the “pause button” and took a break from life? Hundreds of people across the country absolutely LOVE our monthly meetings.

This meetup you will: • Consciously DROP the unwanted baggage you carry around (and deposit it into our famous Universe Box)

• Exist as your true Self without any roles or titles

• Benefit from the atmosphere of total acceptance that we create

We will also do a bit of meditation and have a group discussion on a chosen topic.

Give your authenticity the space to shine among other authentic beings. We hope to meet you here ;)
results.name: Press The "Pause Button" and Drop Your Unwanted Baggage

results.description:
We return  to this "Kasbah" setting  liked by all for Sky Vue a Friday Summer tease weekend kickoff party at the new Mint ... 

A first for Long Island, Garden City Mint features a rooftop lounge equipped with a wrap-around bar, tables and private cabanas, allowing guests to enjoy fine dining and a fine view. 

Happy Hour drink special for us until 8 PM ....... Dance music favorites and  live DJ after dark.....

Multi groups attending lots of new friends await.....Enjoy appetizers and drink specials in the cabanas

The rooftop boasts an outdoor grill, ...where hungry patrons can order their favorite finger foods, including the flavor-packed Tandoor Mint Chicken Kebab, cubes of mint-flavored chicken grilled to perfection; vegetarian Kaju Gobi, cauliflower cooked in rich cashew sauce; or Diwan-e-Handi, assorted veggies, Indian homemade cheese and baby eggplant in spinach curry sauce

Dance Music for a dance with a new friend....Happy Hour Specials till 8 PM...
Live DJ playing dance favorites after dark

No Cover Charge

results.description:
How to be an Artist is an one night workshop by a working artist for actors, performers, artists, musicians and writers.

We will cover: How to make a Living as an Artist. Overcoming the myth of the Starving Artist. Finding your character. Tapping the Unconscious for Creativity and Originality. How to deal with other people heckling you, including your family, friends, peers, critics and even yourself. How to weather the emotional storms of being an artist. How to balance your art and your day job. Master Lee has performed on Sesame Street and Riker’s Island. He is a native New Yorker, legendary street performer and comic. He has written and produced two plays. He has taught Tai-chi & Chi Kung for over 30 years as well as Performance Studies at NYU. He has won two MothSlams. He is writing a book entitled, How to be an artist and not lose your mind. 

Email him at [masked] to reserve a spot. 

Bronx Museum of Art, 1040 Grand Concourse, Bronx, NY

6-9pm; $free

fri may 20

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Hey peeps! I  am all excited that I got us a class on arranging succulents. I think these are so kewl looking and I felt the  price was not bad for what all you get. This is a private event for my groups, only 30 can go so be sure to get your ticket as soon as you decide. All details are below. I hope YOU can make it!

Love, Cassie

Buy tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/succulent-arrangement-workshop-cassies-group-tickets-25172241853

Participants enjoy a social atmosphere at the Plant Design Events Studio, and will learn design techniques to create a customize live succulent plant arrangement. The session will include:Live instructions, tips, techniques, step by step demonstrationsOne-on-one guidance (if needed)A variety of plants (3-5 total based on container and design selected)A selection of containersChoice of top dressing such as pebbles, sand or mossFun trinkets such as shells, large colored rocks, etc.,  to make the arrangement snazzy!  A plant care card will be provided at the end of the session.

Visit the Plant Design Events Facebook for photos and more information:
https://www.facebook.com/plantdesignevents/

View the promotional video:
https://www.facebook.com/plantdesignevents/videos/988444941302152/

==============================================

FAQs

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

The Plant Design Events Studio is located in a multi-strip mall facility, with plenty of parking.  Enter on the side where the Quick Chek store is and use the back door of the building with access to the upstair offices.

What can/can't I bring to the event?

You may bring non-alcholoic drinks and snacks, which will be placed on a separate table, away from the Plant Design work tables.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Feel free to email [masked] with any questions.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Its always a good idea to bring your ticket, especially for late registrations, however, an registered participant list will be available and used for the event.

What is the refund policy?

Based on the need to order supplies in advance and coordination of space, tables, chairs and other equipment, refunds are not available.  However, you may transfer your ticket to another person.

The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?

Yes.

WHENFriday, May 20, 2016 from 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM (EDT) - 

Add to Calendar

WHEREPlant Design Events Studio - Colfax Plaza - 2510 Belmar Boulevard Suite A, Wall Township, NJ 07719 - 

View Map

results.description:
From the National Speleological's Society's "Guide to Responsible Caving:"
Do you really want to go caving? If so, ask yourself why. Caving is not a spectator sport, and it tends to be cold and muddy. Tight passages and long crawls are not uncommon. Dangers include falling down pits, being crushed by falling rocks, drowning, and hypothermia. And then there is the possibility of getting lost and quickly dying of hypothermia or slowly starving to death. But for people trained to cave safely, the rewards are worth the misery and risks.

Still interested? Good! Doesn't sound like fun? That's ok, come along for car camping at Thompson's Lake Campground at Thatcher State Park. If you prefer to stay on the surface, there is great hiking along the Helderburg Escarpment, much of which lies within the park. Saturday, I'll lead a group for caving at Schoharie Cave and <a>Clarksville Cave</a>. Sunday we'll break camp and take it easy with a trip to Howe Caverns, New York's largest commercial cave. 

Howe Caverns will not require any special clothing or gear other than a light jacket. You will stay clean and dry there. The "wild" caves (Schohaire and Clarksville) will require the following:
Three light sources, at least one of which should be a headlamp,
A rock climbing or similar helmet,
Warm, synthetic clothing that won't hold moisture.
Knee and elbow pads are recommended but not required.
I'll send out more details once I know who will be caving.

results.description:
Permaculture Paradise in Northern Nicaragua presented by Greg Todd

 Selva Negra

Founded as a coffee plantation in 1890 by German immigrants, this site has expanded to include cattle, pig and chicken farming, 10,000 sq feet of greenhouse space, 5 ponds, a biodigester, eco-tourist lodging and much more. 

Come and explore the beautiful cloud forests of northern Nicaragua in the vicinity of Matagalpa and Esteli.

Greg Todd is a graduate of our Permaculture design course and a long time researcher in Permaculture systems.

Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup 

Every Third Friday at The Commons
7pm-9pm
$5 Suggested donation - no one turned away!

Permaculture is a whole systems design science that is positively changing the way people think and interact with Earth. Turn problems into solutions by joining us in the discussion, design and implementation of projects in and around Brooklyn and the surrounding region. We are looking to create an active group of motivated beings that want to contribute to all the positive change that is happening in our region and the world. This Meetup will be lead by Andrew Faust and occasional visiting friends. Andrew is director at Center for Bioregional Living which since 2007 has been training permaculture designers in NYC and starting June 1st 2012 at their rural campus in Ellenville, NY. A certificate in Permaculture Design is very helpful but not necessary. Click HERE to join Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup.
results.name: Permaculture Paradise in Nicaragua @Brooklyn Permaculture Meetup

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

If you are looking for something different to do on a Friday Night then look no further!  We have put together a fantastic night of fun, socializing, learning, playing, eating and drinking at Big Deal Casino Academy.  You won't find another social event like this  in the city for this price anywhere!  Whether you know how to play some of these games or have never stepped foot in a casino join us!

What to expect:

We have rented out the event space for Big Deal Casino Academy exclusively for our members and friends to enjoy a casual night in a casino setting.  They have a bar, food and 13 gaming tables.  At the beginning of the night come to socialize, grab a drink or something to nibble on, play some of our icebreaker games and then head to one of the gaming tables. 

The Big Deal Academy instructors will be on hand to explain the games, walk you through how to play then let you actually play using real chips!   Everyone attending that night will be given a handful of chips to play with (no cash value and no cash awarded) but those who wind up with the most chips at the end of the night will win prizes from NYSN. 

You can also go from one table to the next.  There will be Poker, Craps, Baccarat, Roulette and Black Jack.   If you get tired of playing there will be plenty of people to socialize with.

What is included: $35 includes: room rental, instructors and dealers and NYSN staff on hand to help you navigate the night and the games.

*** CLICK ON THE BELOW LINK TO PRE-PAY AND RESERVE YOUR SPOT! *** https://www.eventbrite.com/e/casino-night-party-learn-play-socialize-eat-drink-tickets-25104242465

Not included: food and drinks may be purchased for reasonable prices

Dress code?  Most will come from work, so business casual (if you want to wear your James Bond outfit you can!)
results.name: Casino Night Party: Learn, Play, Socialize, Eat & Drink!

results.description:
Intro to Tantric Healing and Awakening with Wanda & Karen
May 20, 7:00 PM


Hosted at Ripley-Grier Studios 520 8th Ave. room 16U
We expect this event to sell out, so be sure to secure your spot via eventbrite!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/potentize-use-tantric-energy-for-healing-awakening-tickets-25042732487 

(RSVPs on MeetUp do not reflect accurate registration numbers, nor do they secure your spot.)

We have experienced profound personal healing, integration and empowerment from the Tantric Healing and Awakening work of The Source School of Tantra Yoga as pioneered by Charles Muir. This profound body of work releases trauma and numbness held in the body and allows us to open to ecstatic orgasmic pleasure and deep emotional connection. It brings increased consciousness to all levels of our being: physical, sexual, relational, emotional, mental, spiritual and energetic. Sexual practices awaken and connect neural circuitry between erogenous zones and the brain, increasing the capacity to feel expanded pleasure throughout the body, have more powerful, longer orgasms and become multi-orgasmic. Men can learn powerful techniques to both delay ejaculation and expand their range of pleasure.

Emotionally this work opens one up to expanded states of bliss, connection, reverence and ecstatic joy and union.

Register Now: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/potentize-use-tantric-energy-for-healing-awakening-tickets-25042732487

We are honored and privileged to both:


• Facilitate this healing and awakening journey for individuals and couples in our private practice, and

• We're Organizers for Tantra The Art of Conscious Loving Beginner Weekend Seminar with Tantra Master Charles Muir in New York City, October 21-23

This evening workshop will be an introduction to the principles and methods of this body of work. We will share some of our personal experiences with you and guide you in some embodiment practices and beautiful connection exercises. You will get a sense of what to expect in the Weekend Seminar or in private sessions.

All are welcome! No partner needed; all levels of experience; all genders and sexual orientations; both singles and couples. No nudity or sexual activity in class. Fee: $35; Early Bird: $25 by May 10.

We expect this multi-MeetUp event to sell out, so be sure to secure your spot via eventbrite! (RSVPs on MeetUp do not reflect accurate registration numbers, nor do they secure your spot.)

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/potentize-use-tantric-energy-for-healing-awakening-tickets-25042732487

results.description:
Hello everyone! So the first D&D group pointed us in the right direction. So here is what you need to know about this meetup:

-Limited number of spots, and spot priority does go to the people who attended the first meeting.
-It is okay if you have no experience with D&D, in fact most people playing are new to it.
-If you are interested in being part of this D&D group, understand that this meetup is MANDATORY. You also must arrive by 8pm-which is when game play officially starts.
-Game play for this session is about character building and if we have time start a simple quest.

 For those who are serious about this D&D group I encourage you to read/flip through the player's basic rules: http://dnd.wizards.com/products/tabletop/players-basic-rules

and if you are interested in the role of dungeon master, check out: http://dnd.wizards.com/products/tabletop/dm-basic-rules

We are currently looking for some campaigns as well. But i figured these two links will get everyone introduced to the main concepts. Any questions, comments or concerns please reach out.


**Update**

1. Please bring pen and paper to build your character. 

2. I will have some snacks here: Potato chips, and two litters of soda (one coke and one sprite). Feel free to bring snacks. 

3. Please subside from side conversations once the game play has started. It is distracting and makes it harder to hear the speaker.

Buy tix in advance $20, it will sell out: http://morbidanatomymuseum.org/event/shakespeares-funeral-illustrated-lecture-and-costume-party-to-celebrate-shakespeares-400th-death-anniversary/

results.description:
The King in Yellow has turned his gaze upon the Earth! Artists vomit inspiration, fanatics preach doom and destruction, and the madmen shudder and froth in their cells. Play an intrepid investigator attempting to unravel the mysteries threatening the world, traversing continents and dimensions as the hand of the Nameless One stretches farther and farther. Can you stop the King from ascending to his Earthly Throne?

This is a premium RPG event for ages 18+ ran by a staff Dungeon Master who specializes in horror and the macabre.

$20 per session for non-members.

$5 per session for Brooklyn Strategist members.

5-session card at $90.

results.description:
We are going to the Opening of the new movie, "Ma Ma", by the awesome Julio Medem on May 20th, 7 PM, at the Sunshine Cinema.
Penélope Cruz will be there with the in-theater Q&As to support the opening weekend of "Ma Ma".

Ms. Cruz will discuss the film after the 7:10pm shows on Friday and Saturday nights. She will also introduce the film to the 9:45pm shows. Tickets are on sale now.

Cruz (Vicky Cristina Barcelona, Volver) delivers an extraordinarily emotional performance in the newest film from acclaimed writer/director Julio Medem (Sex and Lucía). Honoring the high melodrama of Pedro Almodóvar and Douglas Sirk, Ma Ma follows Magda (Cruz) as she experiences tragedies and miracles alike. Just as Magda is diagnosed with breast cancer, she meets Arturo (Luis Tosar), a devoted husband and father in the midst of unspeakable loss. Their chance encounter leads both down a path of strength, grace, love and rebirth.

Tickets: https://www.landmarktheatres.com/new-york-city/sunshine-cinema/film-info/ma-ma
results.name: Questions-Answers with Penélope Cruz: the Ma Ma Opening

results.description:
We welcome a variety of talents to come and share in music or performing arts.  Any family friendly performances are welcome at any skill level.  The Open Mike Nights strives to be a judgement free night where we can come together with the common interest of music and art.

We will have an Open Mike Night on Friday May 20th @7PM


We will provide food and drinks at the Open Mike Night Cafe. 

We have a piano, a few plug ins for acoustic guitars and other instruments and a couple of microphones. 

Individuals or groups can play about three songs. There will be a sign-up sheet at the front door.  The Open Mike Night is FREE and will always be free.  The only cost is a free-will donation for the food and snacks. 

We ask that all music and performances be family-friendly as there will be a wide variety of ages present. 

If you have any questions feel free to email me at [masked] or (201)[masked]

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Join us for our an Open Mike Night at Zion Lutheran Church in Westwood NJ.

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions
results.name: Acting Class

Mets vs. Brewers, Friday, May 20, 7:10 pm, Citifield.

results.description:
Shamanic Sound Healing and Kirtan!!!

Calling all healers, shamans, bhakti yogi's, teachers, chanters, drummers, lovers of kirtan, sound and vibrational healing and anyone who might want to reduce stress and/or improve their sleep...
This is an event for YOU!
Come take an "energetical and vibrational load off" with a mid week, Wednesday night celebration! Come be in like-minded/hearted, sonic, soul community to enjoy singing/chanting together, journeying into the dreamtime, access regenerative, healing processes/ renewal of your nervous system all while cultivating absolute joy in your soul!!! Dalien, aka 13 HANDS makes his first visit to Neolyth with 25 years of experience in the application of vibrational, shamanic healing, chanting, primordial, sacred vocal channeling and kirtan to create a sense of community, love, tribal connection and take us all into the sacred realm of the dream body to access inner wisdom, subconscious healing and cultivate wonderful community energy together! The night opens with a blessing, then off into deep, dream states as you are supported by Native Flutes, various steel pan, Gongs, Crystal Bowl, ukulele and a variety of ambient instrumentation all tuned to the chakras and the 528 Hz LOVE frequency...and then we CHANT!!!! Bring a drum, rattle or shaker for various parts of the kirtan/singing and interactive portion of the evening.
You'll go to work so happy on Thursday!
Best. Nights. Sleep. Guaranteed!

Event Fee: $25

DALIEN, AKA 13 HANDS, does lots of things.. He leads kirtan, yoga workshops along with other types
of sacred, shamanic sound and song offerings across many different cultures; along with yoga, mind, body, spirit healing and education events. He's a yoga professor, Grammy nominee, sound therapist who loves sharing the healing aspects of the yoga practice and the vibrational application of sound to improve sleep, reduce stress, anxiety and management of PTSD/trauma symptoms; along with assisting those in need of a spiritual shift of consciousness or soul retrieval support. Additionally he brings helpful insight and wisdom about the body, organs, mind and spirit he obtained from his near death journey of curing Crohns, colitis and a host of endocrine issues all cured through natural and holistic methods. He plays 30 instruments and has recorded 15 albums.... so one never knows quite what to expect at an event..,but that's the fun of it!!!... the spontaneity and freedom from where he channels from creates this wonderfully inclusive, family and tribal affair of collaboration, joy, bhakti and love together. He's had the honor to share/teach alongside Shiva Rea to Seane Corn to Krishna Das to Snatam Kaur to Sean Johnson to Jack Kornfield and the Dalai Lama and other luminaries of light in yoga, chant, spirituality, literary, wellness, shamanism and fitness. Come out, sing, dream and chant your heart out.
results.name: A Soul Awakening with Dalien aka 13 Hands

results.description:
You must register via this link to confirm your space:
https://www.coreenergetics.org/event-calendar/#!event/2016/5/20/free-friday-night-8211-the-science-of-changebreaking-the-patterns-that-hold-you-back

What keeps us stuck in the same patterns knowing that we want to change…but yet somehow we can’t? New science has proven that the answer is in your body and in the hardwired networks in your brain.

In this workshop Sam and Lubna give you the necessary knowledge to change any aspect of yourself. You will be taught simple concepts and techniques in order to make the changes you long for in your life.

So stop blaming yourself for not having what you want in your life, there is a reason why you don’t and it’s in your body!

______________
Sam Cagnina, CCEP has a private practice working with mind/body/spirit consciousness in New York City. His depth of understanding of how to gain self-awareness and navigating emotion are exceptional. He is also TRE Provider (Trauma Release). Sam is an award-winning healer for 25 years and has been recognized in Best of New York Magazine, Best of Time Out Magazine and Paper Magazine for his powerful approach to working with the body.
www.samcagnina.com

Lubna Khalid, CCEP has a private Core Energetics practice in New York City and has conducted workshops all over the country. Lubna has been an expert on body and beauty image for the last 20 years and has been featured in publications such as Oprah’s O Magazine, Shape and W. She has traveled globally and spoken to people of all ethnicities supporting them in their issues of self-esteem.
www.lubnakhalid.com
results.name: THE SCIENCE OF CHANGE--Breaking the Patterns That Hold You Back

results.description:
We cover Jazz Standards from the Real Books with focus on the 5th and 6th editions. Welcome horn players, bass, drums, keyboard, guitars and even occasional jazz vocalists, although this venue is more for playing of instruments. The goal is to learn to improvise over changing chords, some complex, while developing your listening and playing skills. We post a suggested set list and participants come prepared to play the songs.

One (1) drummer and one (1) bassist per session only so please communicate with each other and rotate sessions as required. We post some songs to the MORE>FILES section of the web page, but musicians are responsible for bringing their own music. You must RSVP in order to attend as we need to plan out who is attending for Studio space to accommodate musicians. The studio charges $10 per musician.
results.name: Long Island Jazz Jam - Friday's at 7pm

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBD), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call or text me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.(we don't want to worry about you all night)


And the standard 'It's -OK- to decide to come at the last minute, without an RSVP, or late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well.  no need to call, just show up. the tables aren't nailed down and another can always be added.


Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 1:30AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.
results.how_to_find_us: if in a panic, call my cell! 201 621 1066. ask for Greg.
results.name: Friday Veggie Heaven Bi weekly invitation.

results.description:
Contact:   Mike Clancy  [masked]

The actual full moon isn't until the next night but it'll be close!!  Take in the sunset and then check out the nearly-full moon!

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you have sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area. From there, we will head one more mile to the fire tower for even better views!!. We'll probably return by same route but there are also other trails we could take. 


Distance:: 4 miles round trip

Elevation gain:  1,300 feet

Gear: Headlamp/light, water, snack/dinner.

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

                                                     *************

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: (Almost) Full Moon hike - Mt. Beacon Fire Tower- Sunset/Moon Hike - 4 miles

results.description:
Wayne Liquorman is coming to New York for a weekend of Advaita Talks, May 20-22 in the Alexander Technique Center for Performance and Development in Midtown Manhattan. Please note the venue is in the same building, different room from last year: Suite 803, 330 West 38th St. 


"I’m not proposing a formula, I’m simply encouraging you to look more deeply."

"What I’m interested in looking at is what other component is there in desire that may be the real culprit in producing the suffering."
                      

                                     — Wayne Liquorman, January 2015


Wayne Liquorman is one of the great teachers and writers of Advaita (non-duality), which he calls The Living Teaching. He is direct, funny and profoundly serious. His teaching encourages curiosity, accepts you as you are and helps you explore what that is. Come and join us for a weekend exploring our true nature!

As founder of Advaita Press, Wayne edited and published many of Ramesh Balsekar's books. His own books include No Way: for the Spiritually "Advanced" (under the pen name Ram Tzu), Acceptance of What IS, Never Mind and Enlightenment is Not What You Think and are all available from Advaita Press and Amazon. Wayne's most recent book, The Way of Powerlessness, draws on decades of understanding from a life spent living both the Teaching of Advaita and the Tao of AA.

Friday, May 20 • 7:30 - 9 pm • $25 

Saturday, May 21 • 1 - 5 pm• $80 

Sunday, May 22 • 11 - 3 pm• $80 


Alexander Technique Center for Performance and Development, 

330 W 38th st, Suite 803, New York NY 10018

Here's a MAP!

Directions: N, Q, R, S, 1, 2, 3, 7 to TIMES SQUARE 


A, C, E to 42nd st PORT AUTHORITY

LIRR to  PENN STATION

You may attend any or all days. No reservations required but space is limited so you're advised to get there early!


Here's a video of Wayne from a recent webcast:

http://youtu.be/DXvtx1aHlzA

advaita.org

results.description:
Weather's warming up (I think) so let's look forward to summer with some songs (no, this doesn't mean there is a theme to this meetup - it's still your songs, your choice).


BRING:


Acoustic guitar (or mandolin, ukelele, banjo, or just your voice), music stand, tuner, capo, extra strings (just in case), and 12-15 copies of lyrics/chords sheets for 2 songs of your choice. 

7:00PM-ish - We try to have the room open for early arrivals.

7:30 - 9:15PM - Our usual group play. Choose songs with simpler chords that will be fairly easy for the group to play (and won't require a lot explanation). Otherwise, your songs - your choice.

9:15 - 9:30PM - Time for anyone who wishes to perform a song for the group. You don't have to be a pro or a great singer. If you are working on a song (original or cover) and want to try it out, here's your chance. Strictly voluntary but it's a great low-key, supportive environment for the experienced and novice to perform.

9:30 - 10:30PM - After we pack up our gear and straighten up the room, those interested can adjourn to Larchmont Tavern a few doors down for some socializing.

TANGO WORKSHOP for Intermediate/Advanced Students 


Date:         Friday, May 20, 2016

Time:         7:00 to 8:30 PM

Location:  Rooftop Rhythms, Suite #7, 10 South Division Street, New Rochelle

Price:        $35

Reservations/ RSVP to:   [masked]  [masked]


FREE TANGO LESSON for Beginners with Mayte Vicens @ Alvin & Friends Restaurant

If you are a beginner or never danced tango before, we invite you to attend a FREE lesson at Alvin & Friends before the tango party starts

Date:           Friday, May 20, 2016

Time:          7:30 to 8:30 PM  

Location:    Alvin & Friends Restaurant, 14 Memorial Highway, New Rochelle

MILONGA NOBLE CORAZON

Dress to impress and join us for a festive evening of fine dining and elegant tango dancing!

Date:       Friday, May 20, 2016

Time:      8:30 to Midnight - Open Dance Floor          

Show:     10:00 PM - Performance by Cristian Correa and Leah Barsky  

                      *Stage finalists: World Tango Championship 2015*

** Fashion Tango Clothes by Celeste Anabel Deguila will be available for sale at a special discount through the night 

DJ: Edit Fasi


Location:   Alvin & Friends Restaurant, 14 Memorial Highway, New Rochelle
COVER:    $20   (*one drink minimum)

Reservations:  RSVP to [masked] <a>(347)[masked]</a>

**  $50 for both workshop & milonga

Cristian Correa was born in Cordoba, Argentina where he started dancing Argentine Folklore at the age of five.  Mr. Correa has appeared in several films, including “Un Tango Mas”, the story of tango icons Maria Nieves and Juan Carlos Copes. He represented Cordoba in The Tango Mundial Championships where he was sub-champion for three consecutive years.  He has danced in the most renowned tango shows, including Esquina Carlos Gardel, Tango Porteño, La Ventana and Hotel Faena’s “ Rojo Tango”.   He is also the choreographer and director of the historic Querandi Tango show. Mr. Correa is a highly sought out teacher and performer, known for his unique style and dynamic presence. 

Leah Barsky was born in Germany and grew up in NY. She has been dancing since the age of five. Ms. Barsky is a cross-disciplined performer, and is highly proficient in classical ballet, contemporary dance and Argentine tango.  In 2014 she danced in The Mark Morris Production of “L'Allegro, il Penseroso ed il Moderato” at Lincoln Center. Ms. Barsky has also appeared as a featured dancer in several productions with The Chicago Lyric Opera and The Metropolitan Opera. In addition, she danced as one of the final couples in the 2014 and 2015 Mundial Tango Championships. As a cross-cultural person and multidiscipline dancer, Ms. Barsky is a unique performer and insightful teacher. The New York Times raved that Ms. Barsky is “sensual and direct and… the most compelling” performer.

Getting Here: 


If you are arriving by train: The New Haven line Metro-North Station is only 2 blocks from the restaurant. GCT to New Rochelle: 
Trains arrive about every 20-30 min from GCT and CT.
results.name: TANGO WORKSHOP & MILONGA PERFORMANCE with Cristian Correa & Leah Barsky

results.description:
Let’s start at the beginning! 

Whether you’re just curious about tantra, or already a practitioner, this class is for you! We will discuss the origins of Tantra since the cultural context is important to understand this approach to spirituality. We will talk about the different types of Tantra… and how Ipsalu Tantra fits into the mix. Other topics to be covered will include: 

• Sexuality as a gateway to spirituality  

• The difference between red and white Tantra

• What does “expanded consciousness” mean?  

• Activation of the chakras and kundalini

After discussion, we will do an Ipsalu Tantra practice. We will use breath, dance and meditation to spark greater spiritual awareness. So wear loose, comfortable clothing that you can move around in and meditate in. All classes are completely clothed, and there is no explicit sexual contact. However you’ll leave with your heart open and a smile on your face! 

To RSVP for this event and receive directions, please email 

[masked].

Admission: $20 at the door.
results.name: Introduction To Tantra Presented by Tahuti Lodge, O.T.O.

results.description:
The Espejo Organization for the Arts presents “EOarts Performance Art Series 2016: Session 3”. The third night of this four-night series will host two performances; “Bone Minus One” by Angeli and “Nightmare in White” by Emery Medina on May 20th, 2016 at Rabbithole Projects.

“Bone Minus One” is an ongoing performance that presents an interaction that happens amongst and with the audience. Angeli individually invite those present to hold an animal skull between them and move together through the space. Holding death, Anegeli’s performance creates a space to question and challenge socio-cultural constructions of identity. Working at the intersection of disciplines and expanded practices, Sion’s work investigate the performative nature of the body, image, garment, text and other materials. An artist and independent scholar based in New-York city, Angeli is most interested in art that conditions chaos through intensities, resonances and sensations as embodied practice. Her educational background includes a MA in Performance Studies from Tisch School of the Arts, New York University ‘12, and a BFA in fashion theory & practice, w. a focus in performance, Parsons ’11.

“Nightmare in White” is an ongoing performance piece that presents the audience with a masked woman in bridal attire. Embodying what is left of a women who chased after the American dream and marriage and was broken by it, Emery Medina awaits for the audience’s reaction and interaction. Medina’s work explore themes of pop culture, social media usage, the female body, and position of women in our society. A multidisciplinary artists who spent most of her artistic career making large scale paintings and sculptural masks in an abstract-expressionist style, Medina uses pop culture motifs and the female figure with bold vibrant colors and shape in her work. She is a New York-based artist and a graduate from the Fashion Institute of Technology with a major in Fine Arts and minor in Art history.

The Espejo Organization for the Arts is a Bushwick-based arts management organization that is committed to promote the artistic endeavors of mid-career and emerging international artists and creatives. This performance art night is part of EOarts Performance Art Series 2016, an action art program that aims to survey international performance art practices and bring them closer to the public.“Through this performance art series we aim to offer an open and inviting platform where international artists and the public can meet. We want to invite the audience to participate in and engage with performance art, understanding better what this art medium is really about: the power of symbolic action.” said Kika Espejo, founder and director of the the organization.

The Rabbithole Projects Gallery, an art space located on the waterfront of the Dumbo Arts District in Brooklyn, will host EOarts Performance Art Series 2016. “Our goal is to provide the space and community access for talented artists to share their dreams, visions, and creations with inspired attendees. This performance art series will be an unforgettable experience,” said Shawn Lyons, Owner of Rabbithole Projects. “We are incredibly excited to host such an intriguing event.”
results.name: EOarts Performance Art Series. Session 3: Angeli and Emery Medina

results.description:
Have you ever wished that all aspects of your life could work together seamlessly day in and day out? 

Whether you are a parent, a manager at work, a teacher or anyone who manages people of any age, join us to discover how to have it all. For us, this means experiencing excellence, ease and fulfillment at work and at home, while also enjoying your life. We’ll also discuss how to remain centered in stressful situations, how to create a healthy environment that supports you and those around you and how to relate in a more honest and natural way with people of all ages.


We welcome special guest hosts Amy & Andy Gideon, our good friends, employers and owners of TAG Online, a web design, development and hosting company. They are also proud and busy parents to their sons, ages 10 and 13.  They will join us to discover how we can have it all on our lives.
results.name: Having It All!

results.description:
Cathy told me that Marakesh is FANTASTIC!  There's even a Belly Dancer!!! 

Morocco is a country of contrast, magic and timeless wonders. It is blessed with rich nourishing land and mountain snows; beaches and desert and lush oases. Its ancient mosques, synagogues, souks, churches and kasbah exist in harmony with ultra modern cities. It is an exotic blend of Berber, Arabic, Jewish and European cultures.

It is within the true Moroccan tradition that we take the great honor to share this experience with you.  Your host Abdelfettah El Akkari welcomes you to Marakesh, where our Moroccan born chef is pleased to bring his expertise from the Heart of Morocco to the Heart of New Jersey.

Marakesh Restaurant is a marvelous magnificently reproduced palace with the authentic architecture, carvings, tiles, paintings and crafts which resulted from twelve centuries of development of Arabic art.

Our cuisine is presented in a fashion that enhances its surroundings. It is considered by many culinary experts and famous chefs to be among the top three cuisine's in the world.

“It's a BYOB with no corkage fee which really helps defray costs for parties.”


I'm so there...

Using GPS to reach Marakesh Restaurant

We recommend using the intersection of Rt 46 EAST and Edwards Road for your GPS target instead of our street address. Our parking lot main entrance is a few feet further down Rt 46, past the intersection. See below for our explanation and directions.

If you've MISSED our Rt. 46 entrance, you DO NOT NEED MULTIPLE U-TURNS to get to us!

Just continue driving east on Rt. 46 and then make 2 right turns (either through Rutgers Lane, or New Road, etc.) to Edwards Rd. and enter our parking lot entrance on Edwards

Special Treat for this group great lineup, Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Peter Bales, Lineup includes Bob Dibuono (Comedy Central, Tonight Show), Jon Laster, Brian Scott McFadden, Al D and more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

results.description:
Our good friend Nancy has offered to host us at her home this week near Union Square.  This will be a BYOB event, bring some to share if you can.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee
