https://scontent-iad3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/13241323_1142963885782531_4978496070545442393_n.jpg?oh=f6dd9b8be9716a02a00734d625e584e2&oe=57E09B6F

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Rhythmic Variations) w/ Laura and Naomi
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Moves! Patterns! Dancing!) w/ John
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance  w/ Stan and Neil

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Moves! Patterns! Dancing!
Learn new stuff & put it together in interesting ways. We are going to focus solely on new partnered vocabulary for your blues dancing. We will push you to remember new sequences & drill them until you can do them in your sleep (or at least on the dance floor).


This Week: All the Drama 
Blues is very emotional and dramatic. We'll teach you few select moves or combinations to create drama and intensity in your dancing.

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/about/locations
results.name: Friday Night Blues NYC

results.description:
The Place: Just like it's Brooklyn predecessor, all dishes are prepared by wood-burning oven and grill. The room recombines two separate restaurants around a marble horseshoe bar, serving up Italian wine, local craft beer, working class tall boys, and inventive craft cocktails. Guests can eye the Pavesi pizza oven painted like Van Halen’s “Frankenstrat” electric guitar. The restaurant utilizes salvaged décor, a bright yellow marquee sign from the defunct Rentas Liquors, and reclaimed cinema benches from the Czech Republic. Speedy Romeo strives to be an institution in the LES just like it's Brooklyn predecessor

http://www.speedyromeo.com/#home


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Speedy Romeo - Pizza

results.description:
CHANGE OF PLANS --- MEET AT VESELKA, 8:15pm - Special discount menu! Read on...


We're expanding the international flavor of #BromptonNYC to include the East Village Ukrainian staple Veselka (which means "Rainbow" by the way)!!

Tom, Veselka's owner and a Brompton rider, is generously offering a discounted menu to #BromptonNYC and so we'll have extra reason to enjoy their legendary food and service! This is the first big event of the #BromptonNYC season and truly opens the summer riding season. We'll discuss upcoming events, meet and greet friends old and new, and party it up Brompton style on the bike lanes and at one of NYC's culinary gems!

Here's a schedule for the day:

CHANGE OF PLANS --- MEET AT VESELKA, 8:15pm

8:30PM - Pierogi folding demo

Tom Birchard, Veselka's owner and a Brompton rider himself is treating us to an exclusive "How to fold a Pierogi" lesson from Veselka's master makers. We'll all leave with the skills to craft our very own Brompt-rogi! The only question is - what should we fill them with???


UPDATE: After the Pierogi demo we'll head out on a moderately paced, no drop, ride. The route will be a bit fluid and we'll adjust to rider pace and unplanned stops. Here's the general idea... We'll head north and loop once through Central Park, head over the 59th St Bridge to Queens, ride south and stop for a break at the Brompton Cafe in Williamsburg, cruise down to Dumbo, cross the Manhattan bridge, take a look at the Statue of Liberty from Battery park, ride up through Chinatown, and finally....

11:15 - We arrive at Veselka, meet anyone who couldn't make the group ride, fold up, take our seats outside along 2nd ave and get settled. UPDATE: Veselka is generously offering a FREE cup of Borscht to us Brompton riders PLUS a discounted order of 8 Pierogi for $5 (usually $12). So - we'll have extra reason to enjoy their legendary food and service!

At Midnight we'll feast on Borscht, Pierogi, fine Ukrainian beers, and more!

Join us for a fun ride and a good old time!

Special thanks to Veselka for all they've done to make this night a reality!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the folding bikes!!
results.name: Midnight Borscht Ride - Fold your own Pierogi!

FRIDAY, May 20th@ Balcony in Carlstadt NJ

Host 4 This Meetup: Dave Durkin

Have Some Fun At Redd's Restaurant Where 8 Funny Dads Will Take The Stage And Keep You Laughing Out Loud And Entertained!

Doors open at 8:30pm.

Showtime is at 9pm. Please arrive early to claim your seat and mingle with others before the show begins.

Parking is free. Food & Drinks are also available to purchase at the venue.


Cover: $10 Cash At The Door.


Comic Lineup: Monty Mason, Matt Kelly, Jonathan Swift, John Sweeney, Dave Hojnowski, Thomas Rome, Ed Rufolo, And Rosario Scanio Are All Scheduled To Appear.

More Info & Reservations: Call[masked] (Mention Meetup)

Event is listed on a few meetup groups, Facebook, and is advertised locally so a nice sized crowd is expected.

Comedian Credits: Thomas Rome is a winner of the Levity Live Comedy Contest and has performed at Caroline's In NYC. Dave Hojnowski has performed his act at the Taj Mahal In Atlantic City as well as other venues. Matt Kelly is the Co-founder of the Jersey City Comedy Festival and has performed at the Gotham Comedy Club NYC. Johnathan Swift is the owner of the Pulpit Comedy Club in the Bronx NY and has performed at The Broadway Comedy Club.

results.description:
Everyone,

We have customarily gone to dinner every Friday night after hanging out at the Rubin Museum of Art Lounge.  While usually we decide where to go the day of, this time we're going to make it easier for everyone and we're going to one of our favorite place, Saigon Market!

Saigon Market is Vegetarian/Vegan friendly and they do separate checks.  But if you share it's even better!

Vegetarian: Request no fish sauce and let them know your vegetarian when ordering.

Vegan: Request no fish sauce & no eggs, and let them know your vegan when ordering. 

Eddie

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet @ La Fama. We are here every Friday For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class, after admission is also on. Admission: $10.00 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

venue.name: La Fama - Salsa Social

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/
results.name: Salsa Dancing Party in NYC

group.name: Salsa Dance Parties in New York City

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

Friday Night is karaoke night at Sissy McGintys.  

Friendly staff and patrons. Always tons of fun. Come join us this week! 

An up to date songbook is searchable online. Just go to www.madnesskaraoke.com

As always, it's FREE to attend and participate in karaoke but please support our sponsor, Sissy McGinty's, by ordering a few drinks at the bar and tipping your friendly bartender. 

I hope I see you there!

Simon

results.description:
Karaoke is fun! Every other week, let's all meet up in Elmsford, and let loose with some singing!

Karaoke starts at 10:00. Some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand.

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.
results.name: Bi-weekly Karaoke

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!
results.name: Friday Night OUTDOOR Game (@ Hofstra)

results.description:
Friends,

Come and join us at this Friday, May 20 @ Skyroom rooftop. We always have a great time at this venue.

Skyroom is conveniently located near Times Square, and many subway stations. 

This is a multi- Meetup group event, so you will get the opportunity to meet other members from my Meetup groups.

Do get there early so that I will be able to introduce you to the other invitees. Coming early also prevents you from the long lines.

Gents free before midnight. Ladies free before 1am.

Skyroom is definitely one of the top 5 rooftops in the city, and the Friday night party there is a lot of fun! Feel free to invite your friends to this event. 

Please note that the venue has a retractable roof so event will happen rain or shine.


Looking forward in meeting many of you!

Cheers,

Events Organizer

Rory

RendezVous Rooftop Party

Yara and Jean-Philippe are happy to welcome you to our Friday rooftop party in the highest rooftop of NYC: Sky Room : free admission before midnight, free drinks for ladies at our VIP table, Live DJ, and VIP admission if you mention that you're on Yara's Guest List (please read carefully the event recap below).

__________EVENT RECAP__________

Where: Sky Room – 330 West 40th Street New York, NY 10018

We will be on the second floor of the rooftop, cross from the bar and front of the DJ booth.
Call/text Yara[masked] if you need anything.

When: Fridays. Doors open at 10:30 PM and close at 4:00 AM.

More info: http://www.skyroomnyc.com/

results.description:
Animal rights activists free a group of infected chimpanzees to horrifying results in this speculative sci-fi horror effort from Trainspotting director Danny Boyle. Waking from a coma in a deserted London hospital 28 days later, bicycle courier Jim (Cillian Murphy) takes to the deserted city streets in a state of mystified confusion. Joining forces with another group of survivors following a terrifying encounter in a seemingly abandoned church, Jim soon learns the truth behind the deserted streets and the menacing creatures that lurk in the shadows. It's soon revealed that the chimpanzees had been harboring a deadly virus that sends its victims into a furious, murderous rage, and in the days following the initial exposure, the entire population was nearly wiped out due to the resulting homicidal rampage. Is there still a glimmer of hope for humanity -- or has the deadly "rage" virus found its way to foreign shores and infected the entire planet?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c7ynwAgQlDQ

This is our seventh annual super distance walk and our premier challenge event.

As we have done in the past, our walk primarily follows the East Coast Greenway. And, the East Coast Greenway Alliance has promised outstanding support along the way.

This is our most diverse walk, from tranquil parks and rivers to friendly communities to industrial parks and cities - this one has it all. The walk is conveniently near rail lines which makes using mass transit a big plus. If you prefer, create your own challenge by jumping on or off the walk at various schedule points.

results.description:
The Adirondack Mountain Club has a patch program for all 5 of the Catskills plus 23 firetowers in the Adirondacks. In the spirit of other "hike-several-mountains-in-a-day" programs, presenting HVH's 1st ever


5 Catskills firetowers in 1 Day Challenge!!


The 5 Towers in the Catskills are


Red Hill: 2.8 miles round trip, 900' vertical


Balsam Lake: 6.8 miles round trip, 1200' vertical (from Mill Brook PA)


Hunter: 4.4 miles round trip, 2200' vertical (via Becker Hollow)


Tremper: 6 miles round trip, 2000' vertical


Overlook: 5 miles round trip, 1400' vertical


Total hiking distance: 25 miles Total elevation gain: 7,700 ft. Total driving time (in-between towers): 2 hrs, 45 minutes Total driving distance (in-between towers): 97.2 miles

(we'll post more details as the date approaches)


++

The Catskill Fire Tower Passport Program

Earn a Catskill Fire Towers Badge! Hike one (or more) of the Catskills' fire towers between May 10 and October 13, 2014, then log your hike on a Morgan Outdoors Fire Tower Passport, available at Morgan Outdoors in Livingston Manor at 46 Main Street or download it here right now.

Turn in your passport at Morgan Outdoors by October 13th and collect your badge. You'll also be entered in a drawing to win prizes, including handy pair of Nikon Travelite Binoculars.

The Catskill Fire Tower Passport Program is sponsored by Morgan Outdoors and the Watershed Post with support from the New York-New Jersey Trail Conference.

++

This hike is part of a ADK Club Firetower Challenge series. We will hike firetowers in the Adirondacks following this hike :)

Regarding the ADK Club Firetower Challenge:

• you must complete 18/23 Adirondack firetowers

• you must complete 5/5 Catskill firetowers

• you are NOT required to actually CLIMB the firetowers

• record the dates of your visits, impressions etc on this form

http://www.adk-gfs.org/Documents/fire_tower_brochure.pdf


• mail it in with a check of $3 to receive your patch!!


+++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: NY Firetower Challenge: Hike 5 Fire Towers in the Catskills in 1 day

results.description:
The Presby Memorial Iris Gardens is a beautiful gardens close by in Montclair, NJ. The garden is devoted almost exclusively to Irises. They have numerous beds containing an assorted variety of Irises. The beds and Irises are extremely accessible to photographers. One can almost always find the right angle of light.

The Gardens officially opens at 10:00 a.m. but the gate is always open and photographers can access the flower beds at sunrise to take advantage of early morning light. In addition, one can generally find dew on the flowers that early in the morning.

(I'll get there around 7:00 a.m. to take advantage of the sweet morning light.)

Of course, I always come prepared with a spray bottle filled with water and glycerin just in case.

Because of the accessibility of the beds and flowers they are easily photographed with a close up or macro lenses.

Tripods are allowed.

While the garden doesn't charge an entrance fee they do request a donation. Therefore, we are charging $35.00 per person for participation in this workshop and we will make an appropriate donation to the Gardens.

To help you appreciate how accessible the flowers are for the photographer, here are some images taken at the Presby Iris Gardens and other locations.s

  Image by Padma

  Image by Martin Joffe

  Image by Martin Joffe

  Image by Padma

  Image by Martin Joffe

Join us and learn from the experts.


  Image by Padma

I hope that you find these flowers as alluring as I do and chose to join us on May 21st.

Since this is a weather dependent event, we will make a go/no go decision on Thursday, May 19th, 2014 by 6:00 p.m.

Martin Joffe

Padma Inguva
results.name: Presby Iris Gardens in Montclair, New Jersey

results.description:
***Updated[masked]***

The adventures continue! Join us for the next official NYC Adventure Cycling Club overnighter in the Shawnagunks.

This ride will take us up to the Shawangunk Ridge in Ulster County, about 20 miles west of Poughkeepsie. Because this is a weekend overnighter and the Gunks are 109 miles out, we'll be taking the Metro North out of the city to Poughkeepsie, from there we'll bike about 20 miles to the campsite and spend most of the day riding and/or hiking around Minnewaska State Park. There are climbs to be had, old carriage trails to be explored, waterfalls to strike awe, and probably many more gems hidden in the hills. 

The following day we'll pack in more miles on the bike, continuing beyond Poughkeepsie all the way to Peekskill. Here we'll break at the Peekskill Brewery for lunch and local brews before getting on the Metro North, conveniently located near the train station, for the trip home. If anyone wants or needs to bail early there are lots of train options, the nearest being Poughkeepsie. Likewise, if anyone wants to have a longer ride there are lots of options for that (leave a comment with your interest/ideas or message Chris).


We'll meet at Grand Central Station at 7:15 on Saturday morning to catch the 7:43 train to Poughkeepsie. From Poughkeepsie we'll ride 20 miles to the campsite, arrive around 1pm to set up camp, and then head to the hills.

Contact Chris w/ questions -[masked]

Who: NYC Adventure Cycling Club members   

What: Overnight ride from Brooklyn to the Gunks

When: Saturday, May 21st - Sunday, May 22nd

Where: Grand Central Station at 7:15am

Why: Porque no?  Will be a leisurely paced ride on majority sealed tarmac. ~20 miles on day 1 and ~50 on day 2.

Saturday: 

7:15am: Meet at Grand Central Station, grab tickets, coffee, mingle

7:43am-10:00am: Train to Poughkeepsie

10:00am-1:00pm: Ride to the campsite

1:00pm-???: Explore the Gunks

Sunday:

8:00am: Break down camp 

9:00am-2:00pm: Ride to Peekskill for lunch and beers 

3:31pm-4:42pm/4:21pm-5:26pm: Train to Grand Central

Minimum you'll need... 
+ Bike (organizers are on road touring options) 
+ Flat repair kit (tubes, patches, tools, pump, etc) 
+ Sleeping option (tent, hammock, bivy, etc) 
+ Appropriate clothing (may get cold) + Water/snacks 
+ Small amount of $ for food/drinks along the route
+ Still not charging for these rides, but $5 to the organizers to cover cost of campsite/s is MUCH appreciated.

***Disclaimer - Upon RSVP of this Meetup, you agree to “bear all risks” and release the organizers and event hosts from claims, demands, and damages arising out of your use of the platform. Group organizers are not guides. Bicycling on public roads contains risk. Attendees understand and intend that this assumption of risk and release is binding upon their heirs, executors, and guests who are not active members of the New York Adventure Cycling Club Meetup group. Long story short, if you choose to join for rides, organizers are not responsible for participants health, safety, and/or well being.
results.name: NYC-ADV Ride 003 /// The Gunks

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
If you can't arrive at 8am, please leave your arrival time in the comments so I know when to expect you. Thanks. :)

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
By member request, we're making an early return to one of my favorite hiking areas in the tri-state. Melissa, this one is for you. We're going going to be doing one of the most spectacular hikes in the Northeast and one of my personal favorites -- the Labyrinth and Lemon Squeeze in the Shawgunk Mountains. 

We'll start our hike off in the Mohonk Preserve where we're going to stroll the gentle Undercliff trail, a magnificent spectacle with amazing rock formations to our left and sweeping views of the Hudson Valley to our right. If I ended the hike here, you'd head home feeling satisfied, but this is only the appetizer for the visual and physical feast to come. We will continue on to hike the rock formations known as the Labyrinth and Lemon Squeeze. What the heck are they? They are insane views, a crazy knuckle and knee scraping rock labyrinth, and a claustrophobia-defying climb up a deep crevice capped off by 360 degree views from a sky top tower. Yeah, I know, sounds awesome. 

That's how this hike usually goes...but it's 2016 and the same old, same old doesn't cut it anymore!  Today we're going to explore parts of the preserve that I've yet to lay a foot on; we're looking to stomp some virgin rocks. If you've hiked here with me before you really don't want to skip today. Enough said. We may get a little lost. We may have to do some back tracking. Hell, we may even need to call for a rescue party. No one ever said being a modern day Indiana Jones is easy.  

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an ADVANCED loop hike of about 12 miles round trip. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape as this is one of the more challenging treks in area with a bit of elevation gain and a few rock scrambles. We will be out all day so leave your afternoon/evening open.


• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views and smell the flowers. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 2-3 liters of fluid, a packed lunch and/or snacks, and sunscreen.

• There is a preserve day use fee of $12.00 per person.

• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

• RSVP only if you seriously plan to attend as space is limited.

How To Get There ...

Take the New Paltz exit 18 off of the NYS Thruway. Go 7 miles west (through New Paltz) on Route 299 to the end: make right on Route 44-55 and then 1/2 mile to the Visitor Center on right.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where), If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics Rock Stomp: Hiking the Mohonk Preserve

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Total Mileage: 12.1

Total Elevation Gain: about 3500'
Pace/Time: 1.5 mph average / 8-9 hours, including breaks

***** READ THE ENTIRE DESCRIPTION!!

***** DO NOT SIGN UP UNLESS YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY GOING TO ATTEND

***** BE EARLY - STARTS ON TIME - RUNNING LATE YOU MISSED THE HIKE

######  Signups will be waitlisted to assure room for those who have a good record of showing up for hikes and are capable of the distance and elevation, until the day before the hike, when it will be opened for others. 

Rain cancels hike!!

Three peaks of the 35 Catskill peaks over 3500': Blackhead (3940'), Black Dome (3980') and Thomas Cole (3940'). 


Getting there: Take the New York State Thruway to exit 21, Catskill.  Turn left & then right onto Rt. 23 west and go about 21 miles and turn left onto CR65 (sign for Maplecrest).  In about .8 miles, bear left onto CR65A.  Go straight onto CR40 about 1.9 miles to the center of Maplecrest, where CR40 goes to the right.  A short distance up a steep winding hill, Elmer Barnum Rd. goes off to the left (DEC trail sign there).  Continue to the DEC marked parking area at the end of the road..   Be early -- We will leave at 8:30 a.m. SHARP, for the car shuttle to the start!!  Iffy cell phone coverage at parking area, so don't try sending messages. Be Early!!!
  
Route Description:  Leaving the DEC parking area at Colgate Lake, we take the yellow marked CL trail 4.3 miles to intersect with the blue marked ES trail at Dutcher Notch.  Going to the left it's a 2.8 mile ascent to the summit of Blackhead Mtn., with some great view points on the way up.  Then it's a left turn onto the yellow marked BM trail, .7 miles down to Lockwood Gap, where we hit the red marked BD trail, which we take west, over Black Dome (excellent views), Thomas Cole, Camel's Hump (3520') and Caudel (3320'), 4.3 miles to the car spot parking area.

Special Gear / Requirements: Sturdy hiking boots for rocky terrain.  Warm and cool weather wicking clothing, food/water as you feel is appropriate, first aid, NYNJTC map #141 and compass.   Hiking poles can be of great assistance.

 
Group Size: The DEC limits group sizes in the Windham-Blackhead Wilderness to 20.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Catskills 3500 - Blackhead Range via Colgate Lake

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: Please check the member photos to help find others
results.name: Saturday Morning Tennis Meetup @ Washington Park, Union City

venue.name: BklynBridge Station(Manhattan group)& Prospect Pk(Bklyn group))

results.description:
Six Beaches -- FINAL!
Hello Team, Saturday, May 21st - Six Beaches from two locations.
Manhattan group will Meetup outside the Bklyn Bridge train station @ 8:am.

Brooklyn group will meet at Prospect Pk (Parkside & Ocean Av) @ 8:45am. In front of the McDonalds.
Distance: 50 miles from Manhattan and 42 miles from Prospect.
Pace: 12-15mph, this is not fast so don't be discouraged. It allows for us to reach our final destination by 2:pm if not before. I will keep you posted if SAG/vehicle support.
Terrain: All Flat with the exception of bridges
Weather: Cool & Breezy 70/75 degrees, dress accordingly.
Fee: $15 Guidance & support. If we have car support, $5 more.

Beaches--Rockaway, Riis, Plumb, Manhattan, Brighten and Coney Island. This cycling journey starts from two locations, Manhattan and Bklyn. Both groups will MeetUp at Prospect. From there we roll through the neighborhoods of Flatbush, Midwood and Sheepshead Bay. Once we hit the Bklyn/Qns Greenways the pace picks up. There is a turnoff for those wanting more beach time (@ Riis beach) and less bike miles. The route is mostly flat and on bike lanes or bike paths. This is truly a awesome event, can be challenging for some, but the rewards of beer and Nathan's Hotdogs at the end is well worth it! There's a great deli near Rockaway beach where we'll have lunch. Our journey will end in Coney Island where you can jump on a number of trains to your destination back.
This is really a nice inner-city ride! We may have a SAG vehicle trailing us for support and to carry your small bag of goods. A reminder for those of you attending Six Beaches Ride, it will be breezy and cool, dress accordingly.


Please RSVP to me at [masked] if planning to attend. I will only be contacting those who RSVP'd with any changes or updates. Wearing a helmet is a MUST!!!
Email or call me with any questions or concerns. Look forward to meeting you and sharing the camaraderie of cycling!!
Avery


WHAT YOU NEED TO DO TO GET READY TO RIDE:

Check helmet's condition; securely fitted helmet.
"A" air pressure of tires, "B" brakes are firm, "C" chain is clean and lubed.
Check the air pressure of your tires.
Your bike should have a working odometer with speed, distance and cadence if possible.
You should have necessary items for changing a flat tire (spare tube, patch kit, tire levers and pump).
Two water bottles on your bike (use bike water bottles so they don't pop out of water bottle cage).
On-The-Go snacks stored in your jersey's back pockets
Carry some form of ID (RoadID band)
This is a rain or shine series (unless storms are forecasted).
You'll need to sign liability waiver and fill out general information form with an emergency contact person(s).
Arrive 15 minutes before start time Coach Avery
results.name: SIX BEACHES RIDE!!!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday - 8:30am@W102nd Street Field

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it).
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.) Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances. We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: We'll play rain or shine. We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

Late cancellations and no-shows will get you removed from future events.


Game usually starts at 9:00. Please only rsvp if you plan on staying until the end.

results.description:
Celebrate International Migratory Bird Month with an invigorating walk guided by an Audubon expert from The Theodore Roosevelt Sanctuary and Audubon Center. 

$12.00 - General Admission for House & Gardens

$10.00 - Over 62.  , members of Garden guild free 

Bring binoculars , camera and wear comfortable shoes

be on site by 8:45 

Old Westbury Gardens, listed on the National Register of Historic Places, is the former home of John S. Phipps, his wife, Margarita Grace Phipps and their four children.  Completed in 1906 by the English designer, George A. Crawley, the magnificent Charles II-style mansion is nestled amid 200 acres of formal gardens, landscaped grounds, woodlands, ponds and lakes.  Westbury House is furnished with fine English antiques and decorative arts from the more than fifty years of the family's residence.
results.how_to_find_us: meet group and Audubon guide , main lots edge adjacent to Mansion

results.description:
Trailhead:  On Coreys Rd, 5.7 miles from Route 3.
Google Link to Trailhead

Seymour:  Neglected Brother of the Sewards
------------------------------------------------------------------
13.8 Miles / 3150'  
------------------------------------------------------------------


This is part of an ADK weekend! 


Friday Night - There is no meetup for late-Friday car-camping somewhere between here and there, but if interested, contact the organizer / watch for comments.

Saturday - This Meetup!

Saturday Night - Dinner in Lake Placid / Sat Camping


Sunday - Big Slide!

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VgiePNA2Rik/UvKYBSkNWHI/AAAAAAAAB7g/Z_1qrkpWg94/s1600/SYMR+Pano+5.JPG

------------------------------------------------------------------
Time and Pace:


Start Time:  9am
Minimum Pace:  1.5 MPH Overall Average
9 Hours Hike Time.
Off the Trail By 6pm.
Mostly flat terrain.  Should be a very easy for the mileage.


------------------------------------------------------------------
Notes:


This hike is as late as possible, before bug-season, in hopes that Corey's Rd will be open and there will be No Bugs.  Mileage depends on gate being open.  The road should be open by then, but if it is not we'll either have to add 6 miles, or postpone.  I expect it to open mid-May. 
DEC Trail Conditions - High Peaks Region


The side-trail up Seymour is not a trail, but a herd path.   It is not maintained or blazed.

High Peaks Wilderness

 
DEC Day-hike Group Size Limit:  15

------------------------------------------------------------------
Planned Route:

Start at summer parking.


About 5.6 miles of fairly level travel to the Seymour Herd Path.

Hang a Right.

Up and Down the herd path.

Back to the cars.

------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional Notes:

As always, GPS with the points below, maps, and tracks is recommended, and map/compass/headlamp required.

Bring more than enough cloths, food and water.

Please do not show up without an RSVP or contacting a host.

http://4.bp.blogspot.com/--5Umu2MbLh0/UvKbOSYebeI/AAAAAAAAB8c/JqFjzLDY3lc/s1600/IMG_6768.JPG

------------------------------------------------------------------
Navigation:

Unless you are familiar with the area, if you have a GPS, please load these items:

Points and Tracks on GoogleMaps

Trailhead Starting / Ending: [masked], [masked]
(DMS Format:  44°11'28.76"N, 74°15'48.21"W)

------------------------------------------------------------------
Waivers and Stuff:


If you join this event you are responsible for yourself in all regards; including but not limited to the following.  You must be prepared to navigate yourself to your objectives and back to your vehicle.  Which means being familiar with the route prior to arrival, and bringing whatever navigation aids necessary.  You must know the mileage / elevation gain / terrain / planned pace, and be familiar with your ability to traverse them, and what gear is recommended for yourself given the conditions.  Unless the meetup is labeled as "Beginner", it is your responsibility to gauge your ability to keep up with the group and get to the vehicles within a time-frame as to not cause alarm; this may mean that you may not meet all of your objectives.  Your first objective is always to get back to the vehicles safely, and let the rest of the group get on with their trip, so keep track of the time, turn around if you need to, and try to let people know if you think you might disappear.  There will be no gear-check, but extra food, extra water, rain layers, headlamp, lighter, compass, and whistle, should be things that you are very rarely without.  Most people are unfamiliar with how quickly rain on a previously 90 degree day can become a survival situation, so it warrants saying that, if there is any chance of rain, you need raingear.

------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Tentative Schedule

Morning: Large Versions

Global 1940 & Anniversary Edition

Afternoon (2PM?): Standard Size Versions

1942,Revised,Classic,1914

Evening (7PM?): Not Quite A&A

D-Day, Guadacanal, Bulge,1941, Original Nova Games Edition,Europe,Pacific

Quartermaster General, Dust, Magnifico, World War IV, Superpowers, Conquest of Nerath, Kings & Things, Small World, Branded Risk versions, Imperial 2030, Buck Rogers, Blood Feud in New York, Conquest of the Empire, Conquest of the Pacific, Fortress America, Amerika, War in the Age of Imperialism, East & West, The Wargame, War on Terror: The Boardgame

Throughout the Day

Team play against the computer (TripleA) tournament, trying to see who can win fastest using either Revised edition or[masked]nd edition.

Admission

$15. Covers snacks.

Notes

1.  The times are guidelines only.Show up and play.

2.  A&A is a multi-player team game. There is no problem with showing up in the middle or leaving early

3. You can play 2 games at once. You generally spend a lot of time waiting  for your turn so you can participate in another game. Your allies can always roll dice for you

4. Beginners are welcome. We will explain the rules to you. Team play against the computer is a good way to learn.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Saturday Morning Run

results.description:
Volunteers are needed to help out with a food drive for Bread of Life food pantry!  Bread of Life provides food to families and over 20 church & government food pantries and shelters throughout southern Westchester County.  Come be a part of this great organization for the day (or weekend)!


When:  Sat May 21st and Sun May 22

The food drive will be held from 9am to 5pm on both days. 


Where:  Stop & Shop, 152 Westchester Ave, White Plains, NY

please specify day and time you are able to volunteer. Volunteers are asked to commit to at least a 2 hr shift
Any questions contact
[masked]

About Bread of Life:  Bread of Life is a Rye, NY based not-for-profit organization committed to serving our neighborhood. It is the only food rescue organization, which also has its own on-site food pantry. We pick up locally and deliver free of charge to neighborhood food pantries, soup kitchens and shelters, serving over 12,000 hungry weekly. Bread of Life receives its food supplies from various sources, but one unique source is donations by local businesses of excess food that would otherwise be discarded as waste.  Bread of Life’s beneficiaries are not only physically hungry, but are also in need of assurance that their lives are matter.

**All minors must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.  Thanks!**

New York NY

Players of all level are welcome.

Membership to NYC Recreations Centers is required.

$25 for 12 months (young adults 18 years - 24 years)
$75 for 6 months.
$150 for 12 months.

Come out, make new friends, have a good time, get healthy. :)

To get a membership you will need an ID & Credit Card. Other forms of payment may work, but am not sure.

FYI:

- it is nice if everyone brings some shuttles, preferably feathered Yonex Aerosensa or Aeroplane Black.
- ask the staff at Tony DaPolito and they will direct you to the badminton courts. - badminton racquets may be borrowed at the center (no charge).
- When you come in, please sign in for a spot to play.
- There are NO Trials. Staff can provide a tour of the facilities, but they will NOT allow you to play without a membership.

Only 30 miles from New York City, Harriman State Park's scenic beauty and hilly terrain will make you feel like you're in the Adirondacks. We will host both the Half and Olympic races on the same day. This race is limited to a combined field of 500. All details, including pricing, is listed on our website. Moderate pace, 8+ miles, 6+ hours. A walk that will guide you past the Museums and Cultural Institutions located on Manhattan’s east side.

MEET: 9 AM above the gold statue of Prometheus between 49th and 50th Sts.-opposite 30 Rockefeller Center. Subway: Take the D or F train to 47-50th St.; the 6 train to 51st St.; the N or R train to 49th Street. Bring lunch, water, and snacks. Heavy rain cancels.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
Hope Hill will be participating in a street evangelism outreach with a congregation in the Harlem community. We believe in the value of sharing truth from one human to another, so we will be preparing to share our life stories of hope, to sing, and tell people of the salvation and hope that Jesus offers. A devotional will be held before the beginning of the outreach, and prayer and the handing out of assignments will be given at this time. After the outreach, we will come back together to pray for those people we met. Let's take some time to focus on the community this Saturday. You don't want to miss this!

Bring: A Bagged Lunch
Meetup: Bethel Gospel Assembly, 2 E. 120th St., Harlem (9:00am)

HopeHill.com
#HopeHillNYC
results.name: Heart of Harlem Street Outreach

results.description:
Note:  There is a registration cap and you must email the hike leader to register.  Please click the link at the bottom.

Join us as we hike approximately 8.5 miles from Breakneck Ridge to Cold Spring on Saturday May 21. We'll start the day by rock scrambling for half a mile and then hiking for about 3.3 miles to the Mount Beacon fire tower. We'll then embark on a 4.8-mile hike to Cold Spring by taking the Breakneck Ridge Trail, Notch Trail, Brook Trail and Cornish Trail. We'll end our journey at Whistling Willie's American Grill where we'll grab dinner and drinks before heading back home. 

Additional details and registration instructions can be found here: http://bit.ly/22f17ea
results.name: Young Members - Breakneck Ridge to Cold Spring Hike

results.description:
ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!! Turf shoes and indoor shoes are ay-okay.  

Permit Disclosure: We DON'T HAVE a permit; but the field is usually unoccupied at this time

PLEASE BRING A WHITE SHIRT, A DARK SHIRT & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT

Game Host - James P

Co-leader - Prakash K.

Location -We're playing outdoor at John Murray Playground in Long Island City.

PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 845AM!! Teams will be picked from this time.

Rules:


Fun Play 
No Sliding 
Goals after half point only. 
Kick-ins.. no throw ins. 
Corner kicks. 
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

results.description:
Length: 16 miles

Elevation gain:  ~5000 ft


Difficulty: strenuous

Meeting point:  The main parking lot at Breakneck,   ~ 1/4 north of the tunnel :

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Breakneck+Ridge+Parking/@41.4446669,-73.9807845,771m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m7!1m4!3m3!1s0x89dd331a43579b4f:0x5416717295f588b!2sBreakneck+Ridge+Trail,+Cold+Spring,+NY+10516!3b1!3m1!1s0x89dd331e8d9a6fe9:0xd593cb8e38e817fa!6m1!1e1


There is a train arriving from GC at 9:08  at the Breakneck station.

Trail:


We will start going up Breakneck, following the white trail to Beacon fire tower, then down to the reservoir, around it to the access road, climb up Lamb Hill, then to the Fishkill Ridge loop , then join the yellow trail which takes us over Sugar Loaf back to the parking lot.  We are not going down on Breakneck.

This is a fast paced strenuous hike, with a lot of ups and downs, scrambling etc.  It is recommended for experienced hikers only.  Please bring your own map, there will be no sweep.  Hiking poles highly recommended.

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Connect, socialize and bond with other members while traversing up one of the most scenic rock scrambles and hikes within 1.5 hrs. of NYC. 


This is a free hike is led by Carson Tang of Powermastery.

Register at: 

https://mohonkscramble.eventbrite.com/

Boulder caves, the Labryinth, rock scrambles, waterfall and hiking splendor throughout the day followed up by a refreshing apres hike social bite and brew before heading home following an incredible hike day


REGISTER: 

https://mohonkscramble.eventbrite.com/

One of the most scenic rock scrambles and hikes within 1.5 hrs. of NYC.

Mohonk Preserve is eye candy for those who love the boulder fields and caves that we'll be scrambling and hiking through. World renown for multi-pitch climbing.. you may see some climbers and people bouldering on the rock walls while we hike by.

Exciting yet challenging terrain, fun and nothing like it this close to the city.

Date: Saturday, May 21, 2016
Time: 9:30am Start
Miles: 6-8 miles
Pace: Casual to Moderate
Level: Advanced beginners welcome but need to be sure footed and able to hike the mileage
Gain: Under 600'
Cost: FREE to join group; Park Use Fee: $15
Apres Social: A bite and brew before going home in New Paltz, NY
Now Register: https://mohonkscramble.eventbrite.com/

Fun and challenge for all ages. Possible swim stop at waterfall and watering hole if temperatures warrant.

Exit 18 on NY State Thruway (New Paltz). Give yourself extra time as traffic sometimes backs up in the area on Thruway. The Plattekill Travel Plaza is just before Exit 18, use restroom, grab coffee, etc here before continuing to New Paltz (15 min) - http://www.thruway.ny.gov/travelers/travelplazas/tp-plattekill.html. 

Meet at Clove Road parking lot at 9:30am. Make left on Main Street (Rt. 299) after you exit NY State Thruway toll booth. Head off to Rt 44/55 bearing right at end of Main St (see metal bridge after Gilded Otter). Continue straight after bridge (do NOT turn right after bridge) and stay to right at fork. At end of Rt 44/55 is "T" intersection near Bavarian Restaurant. turn right and head off past Mohonk Visitor Center to hair pin turn. Pass under walkway and Trapps parking lot. At Clove Road it seems like a fork - go right at this turn off and follow road until you get to Clove Road Parking (Split Rock) for Mohonk Preserve. You'll have to pay ranger here their visitor day use fee.

Mohonk information: http://www.mohonkpreserve.org/map-and-directions.

Bring:

Hiking shoes or boots
2+ liters of water
Lunch (if you're joining us afterwards snacks will suffice)
Light outer layer
Daypack to leave your hands free on scrambles

Optional:

Swim suit and towel if weather warrants a swim
Climbing gloves
Camera
Bug repellent
Headlamp or flashlight for entering boulder caves
Mohonk member pass (if you have one)
Spare shirt/top for after hike
Spare shoes for the comfortable ride up and back
ID if you intend to throw back some micro brews
Emergency meds if needed e.g. epi needle
Bathing suit and towel if you want to take a quick dunk in waterfall after hike

REGISTRATION REQUIRED - this is in case plans change due to weather or lot closings and we need to contact you.
https://mohonkscramble.eventbrite.com/

We do not hold up the group if you are running late. The hike and festivities will start as scheduled.

Please let us know if you have a car and can offer ride shares (how many passengers and from where are you driving); or are a passenger and need a ride (each participant must register individually here; $20 donation to driver is expected).

Thank you for making our trips outstanding!
Carson

http://powermastery.com/
Registration link: https://mohonkscramble.eventbrite.com/

The initial ascent is a steep ascent with hand over hand rock scrambling over three false summits.

You must be in good cardio vascular condition to challenge this mountain.
No technical equipment needed. Camera is optional.
results.name: NYPT and Powermastery Sociable Day Mohonk Preserve Hike and Rock Scramble

results.description:
This volunteer opportunity helps a segment of the NYC population that is particularly vulnerable (our home-bound seniors) and is facing a steadily growing problem - hunger. As our city’s elderly grow older, they are more likely to have mobility limitations, while living at or below the poverty level. The elderly of East Harlem are particularly more vulnerable, residing in challenging living conditions alone, and who can no longer shop or cook for themselves.

Citymeals-on-Wheels (www.citymeals.org) raises private funds to ensure no homebound elderly New Yorker will ever go a day without food or human company. Citymeals funds 33 community-based agencies that bring weekend, holiday and emergency meals to homebound elderly New Yorkers - one of the agencies we'll be helping as volunteers.

How are we helping?

On Saturday, May 21st, we'll assist the Stanley Isaacs Senior Center Citymeals-on-Wheels program with delivery of meals to the elderly. Volunteers should wear weather appropriate clothes and comfortable shoes as deliveries are done on foot within walking distance from the meal center.  Although the weather may not always be favorable, the meals MUST be delivered as many, if not all, of the elderly in the program RELY on the meal delivery for the day.

Our Meetup

We'll meet at the Senior Center at 9:30am on Saturday for a short training, then break into small teams of 3 to 4 people to deliver the meals to the elderly. A light breakfast of juice, coffee, pastry and/or bagels will be offered.

If you RSVP, please try to be on time, or arrive no later than 9:30am, which is when we start delivery. The time commitment ends at 12pm and goes by very quickly.

Afterwards, we'll have brunch at The District - 1679 Third Avenue, on the corner of 94th Street, when everyone is done with their deliveries around 12:30pm.

If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646.

Directions to the Union Settlement Senior Center

The Stanley Isaacs Senior Center is located at 415 East 93rd Street. The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 93rd street & 1st Avenue. The building is offset from the street (toward the FDR Drive), enter through sliding glass doors. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Avenue (uptown) or 2nd Avenue (downtown).

Thanks and see you there!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Here is a typical agenda of Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club's meeting.


• The Sgt at Arms calls for meeting to begin

• President of the club welcomes members and guests.  Invites the Toastmaster of the day to facilitate the meeting

• Toastmaster of the Day (TMOD) introduces other duty holders.


• TMOD invites speakers who have scheduled to speak that day. Members take turns to complete their projects under the Competent Communication manual or from one of the advanced manuals. Members & Guests offer feedback to the speakers. They also fill out ballots to select best speaker.


• After the prepared speeches segment is complete, Impromptu speeches (Table Topics) segment begins. All Guests are invited to participate. The goal is to think on your feet and speak for 1 to 2 minutes. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best Table Topics contestant.


• Short Break to enable socializing & networking.


• Meeting reconvenes. General Evaluator takes charge of the meeting. Invites Evaluators to present their feedback on the prepared speeches. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best evaluator.


• General Evaluators returns the control of the meeting back to the President of the club.


• President gives away awards to the best speaker, best Table Topics contestant and best Evaluator.


• Meeting comes to an end approximately between 12.15 pm and 12.30 pm.

results.description:
Dear STSANY members:

UPDATE:

45 minute Private lessons in singing and acting are available to you every Saturday between 10 a.m. and 1 p.m., and weekdays/nights between 11:00 a.m.-7:00 p.m., unless otherwise notified. First come, first served!

NOTE: Available Times for this Meetup are: 10:00, 10:45, 11:30 a.m. and 12:15 p.m.

LESSONS MUST BE SCHEDULED at least one week prior, unless by special arrangement. Kindly include your email address and phone number so I can call you with a confirmation.

IMPORTANT: Once we schedule a time for your lesson, you must double-confirm by calling me 2 days before. Cancellations must be made at least 24 hours before your lesson without charge. Lessons cancelled late must be paid for and/or made up.

IMPORTANT: Special Member Discount Fee: $75 (exact amount in cash at the door). Non-Members: $85. Observing Guests may attend for a $15 fee.

RSVP deadline is one week prior to your lesson. Since Saturday lessons are popular and limited in number, it is highly recommended you do not wait until the last minute to reserve a time since non-members also schedule lessons.

Please RSVP separately for each lesson. If you have already made an appointment for this meetup, privately, kindly RSVP on this page, as well. Thank you!

I look forward to working with you!

Cheers,

Anna

Endorsements by STSANY members and fellow performers:

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting many helpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor and playwright.

It was a wonderful session w/ a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Great session; good, helpful feedback; supportive.____Barbara, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on (for longer than I'd like to say) into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. I am eager to do more! Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. I would definitely like to perform in this type of event again. For me, once a season would be good (3-4 times a year)."____Rebecca MacLean, Acting Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding musicale.I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

results.description:
Bring iPod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is "Dance Walking"? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. Shyness and judgment burn off within 10 minutes. Once you're warm and hit your musical flow, you will rejoice in the liberation of Dance Walk. 

Check out this funny and smart article published about the Dance Walk in Prospect Park: 

http://themomtropolis.com/dance-walk-you-know-you-want-to/

results.description:
Thrive in the Park is a place to make friends, have fun and get fit.

Our *donation based workouts are designed by fitness experts and are for everyone, at any level of fitness. 

WORKOUT DETAILS:


The work out consists of body weight exercises (ex. pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps), team competitions, partner exercises, and cardio (jumping jacks, jogging, sprints, jump rope).

We do not count reps, but rather have a "do as many as you can in 1 minute" style of encouragement.

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you within 24 hours.

WHAT TO BRING:


A water bottle, your determination and your *donation*. All donations are invested back into Thrive in the Park

TESTIMONIALS:

Achelle - "#ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!"

Maria - "#ThriveInThePark is what I look forward to every week, there is nothing cooler than working out, laughing, and bonding with great people who care for their health. Rain or shine we thrive."

Andie - "#ThriveInThePark I never thought I would enjoy waking up early on a Saturday, but now I look forward to it, fun workouts with friends that keep you motivated to push yourself!"

Dani - "#ThriveInThePark I Love everything about it! Such a positive way to bring community together for some weekend activity. The guys/girls that lead the workout and stretches bring such great energy to the group, we basically laugh the whole time - until the lunges and burpees come along, no one laughs at those."

Devon - "#ThriveInThePark provides a necessary jolt of inspiration and aspiration to anyone looking to improve their life."

Ben - "#ThriveInThePark is all about community and giving back, I couldn't think about a better way to spend my Saturday mornings."

Marco - #ThriveInThePark is great because it connects mind body and soul! We learn new techniques, we motivate each other and meet interesting people from all over the world!"

HISTORY:

Thrive in the Park started in the spring of 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too, will go into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

LINKS:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com 

Sponsored by: http://www.soRipe.com
