The Madison Square Park Dog Run:

This is definitely one of the nicest dog runs in Manhattan, with 2 separate fully fenced areas, doggie water fountains, umbrellas and trees for shade, and ample seating.

results.description:
Every time we have a fencing meetup in the park, we meet new people.  Some of them are meetup members who couldn't make meetups at other times, others are just people in the park.  But they're all fun.

Cancellations are much more likely in the summer!  A meetup can be canceled because the ground is too wet, rain is predicted, high heat & humidity are predicted, or just because there aren't enough people committed to being there.  PLEASE RSVP, and come if you say you will. I will post cancellations here by 9am on the day.


To find us, enter the park via the entrance opposite the Ethical Culture School (The Ethical Culture School is on the west side of Central Park West) at 63rd and Central Park West.  The "Backup Fencing Spot" is on your right, just inside the entrance to the park.  Soccer kids have been grabbing our "Where We Fence" location pretty steadily, but to find it, follow the paved path in a large arc to your left, (It starts off heading SE and curves around to NW).  The "Where We Fence" location is on the hard packed dirt under the trees. 


We have a very limited amount of equipment to lend. We're willing to share, but if you have your own equipment, please bring it.

It's also a good idea to bring water!

A more detailed map of where we fence in Central Park is here:

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=212152258049056562883.0004db7dc1516e1da7244&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=m&z=17&vpsrc=0

If you're having trouble finding us, call my cell[masked]  It's a good idea to have my cell handy in case we are forced to move.

I look forward to fencing you!

- Mike

results.description:
Only $5 First Class! Come!

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class (as is the activity of any repetitive movement sport) is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely combo WILL enhance your inner and outer being, release physical, mental, and emotional tensions, chi/prana circulation, flexibility, range of movement, and focus!

Why Yin?- Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive (walking/sitting/running/cycling) movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles and joints. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga class, one can experience tension release and greater ease in movement******GREAT FOR RUNNERS AND CYCLISTS FOR REPETITIVE INJURY PREVENTION!

Each Yin Yang Yoga class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 3-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the stagnant energy and its RELEASE AROUND THE HIPS, THIGHS, AND LOWER BACK, and tune into the breath. The Yang flow designed to follow allows students to integrate the newly released energy and expand it into all the joint spaces. Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

______________________________________________

Testimony:

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

_________________________________________

By Cash or Check

ONLY $5 FOR FIRST CLASS!!

RSVP ON THIS MEETUP $15

Class Card $130/10 + 1 Class Card, or $11.82/class *****BEST DEAL!

Please dress in layers and it's okay to eat prior. Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see you under the arch!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

PLEASE BRING BOTH A BLUE T-SHIRT & A WHITE T-SHIRT.                                                                                                                                                                                 Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  games are 7v7 including goalie, NO slide tackles, excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!).  

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St.with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We meet at 10:45am and start walking at 11am.

Is something bothering you at the moment? Are your longing for something? Perhaps you want more peace of mind, less stress, more personal leadership, you name it. Come to this walking mini-workshop and gain clarity in something you want clarity in. A long the way meet each other and have fun. Escape you small apt. and get out.


About the mini-workshop:

In this workshop you are the starting point, you take with you a challenge and together in little groups we will practice the I Philosophy circle. Borrowing techniques from Mindfulness, science and mediation we will walk & talk and walk through the different step. You go home with clarity and self-compassion, perhaps even a very tangible solution for something that's bothering you.


"Become your own best problem solver"

About the founder of this method:

Eva Helmond is a life and career coach, she has her own radio show where she interviewed over 500 managers and entrepreneurs, she started as a Human Resources manager at a young age and now she brought I Philosophy to New York. Come and join her at her workshops and walk & talks.
results.name: Walk & Talk - mini-workshop I Philosophy

results.description:
Brooklyn has a long history of battles, from the Revolutionary War, to classic playground games, to renovation and development.

Join us for Show & Tale’s special Old Stone House & Washington Park edition, and bring an object that reflects your Brooklyn Battle.

Do you have a Revolutionary War cannon ball that worked its way up into your backyard?  Games and toys from your Brooklyn childhood?   Objects found during your home renovation and restoration?  Items purchased or passed on to you that reflect the history of your home? Every Thing has a story.

It’s like the Antiques Roadshow meets The Moth, or your favorite Pinterest board come to life!

Everyone is welcome to share with a 3-minute limit. No judges, no prizes, no competition. And no need to practice! Just show your object and share its tale.

Just want to come and listen? Awesome! Observers always welcome!

In recognition of May as Personal History Awareness Month State Senator Jesse Hamilton will be honoring 2 amazing personal history organizations: StoryCorp & Digital Diaspora Family Reunion!


Sponsored by: The Old Stone House, The Brownstone Detective, designer Maggie Cousins, Pull Brewing (offering up FREE beer) & the Scott Klein team of Douglass Elliman
results.name: Show & Tale: Brooklyn Battles

results.description:
This class will be taught over a weekend running Saturday and Sunday 11am - 4pm both days.

Want to learn programming fundamentals in a language that you can use to build websites, program robots, visualize data, run servers, and make art? In Introduction to Python you'll learn just that!


Python powers some of the world's most popular websites and apps, like Google, reddit, Pinterest and Instagram.

Join us for this intro class designed for those who have very limited or no programming experience. During this interactive class, we'll explore the basic components of a programming language: data types, functions, conditional statements and loops. We will mix lecture and practice, and we'll work through lots of problems together. You'll leave the workshop with the knowledge, confidence and enthusiasm to continue coding.

Class 1: Intro to Programming and Set Up | SATURDAY MAY 21, 11am-4pm
Class 2: Conditionals, Loops, Functios | SUNDAY MAY 22, 11am-4pm 

We'll spend part of the class helping you set up a development environment, so there's no need to install software ahead of time. Just bring your laptop and come prepared to write your first lines of Python code.

This class is $90.00; the cost covers both days of courses.

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 

Interested in TA-ing or being a volunteer? Fill out this form and the organizer will contact you!


About the instructor 
Amy Durcan is a very active member of the python community. Co-Organizer of Learn Python NYC and The New York Python Meetup Group, she has dedicated herself to both her own progression as a programmer along with helping beginners get the hang of python. With a background in Mathematics (and Studio Art), she focuses on data-related programming, including machine learning. In addition to instructing for GDI, she spends her time coding (most likely in python), kickboxing, and strolling through Central Park.

results.description:
The Five Aggregates - Physical Form

"Impermanence and selflessness are not negative aspect of life, but the very foundation on which life is built. Impermanence is the constant transformation of things.
Without impermanence, there can be no life. Selflessness is the interdependent nature of all things. Without interdependence, nothing could exist."

Thich Nhat Hanh

This week we will continue our look at Buddhism and the Self and begin examining the teachings of the Five Aggregates. The term aggregate refers to groups or bundles of processes from the most basic to the most intricate that are part of every experience. Contemplating and interpreting these processes is our window into how our concept of "self" gets constructed.

We'll start with what is most obvious and most tangible, the First Aggregate of physical or material forms. These are the objects around us including our own bodies. We understand the Aggregate of Physical Form through our five sense organs and the physical objects to which they correspond; the eyes and visible objects, the ears and sound, the nose and smell, the tongue and taste, and the skin and tangible objects. We also know qualities like color and sound and taste and smell. It is helpful at this physical level to describe our "felt" sense of the material, physical world and work mindfully with physical sensations like heat, cold, pressure, vibration, heaviness or lightness.

This first teaching is profound in a couple of ways.  First, not only do we have conscious contact with the objects that correspond to each sense organ, but we can observe their impermanent nature; we observe how they come and go either as a result of our changing attentional focus or the impermanent changeability of the objects. Secondly, we can notice how quickly we "jump" to the conceptual level where we label and name objects instead of being with the actual, direct experience with objects. This leads us to mistakenly assume that because in our minds the labels we apply don't change, the object itself must also be permanent and unchanging. As a result we often forsake our understanding of the reality of impermanence.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Buddhism and the Self - Aggregate of Material Forms

Hope to see you at the lab!

---

This is it -- your *NEW* regularly-occurring opportunity to get more hands-on time hacking F#!

We'll be featuring a coding dojo every month (and in time we might transition to progressive development projects). But it's also an open invite for anything and everything F#. Want to contribute to some great open-source F# projects? C'mon down! Want to gather feedback on an upcoming presentation topic? That's cool, too. Open Play for Advanced Beginners and Intermediate Players.

Our game starts promptly at 11:30am.  You are welcome to come slightly earlier to change and warm up.

We can accommodate 3 teams, 8 players per team max (double rotation). Rally scoring. Game to 15 when it's 3 teams, Game to 25 when it's 2 teams. 

IMPORTANT - Skill Level Required for our Open Play

Know how to rotate on the court, serve, pass, set, spike and block. Know how to hold your position on the court during defense and offense.  This is meant for players that have experience playing.

Rules will be enforced to protect all players from safety and fun.

Recreational players and beginners can practice on the side or come watch for FREE.


If you will be attending for the first time, please check in with me for a quick 3 min assessment. 

Thanks and hope to see you on the court!

May
results.name: Volleyball Open Play

venue.name: Meet at the Beach Between Lindell & Washington

results.description:
Check out the LIRR schedule here http://lirr42.mta.info/

On May 21st, people across the world will come together to join hands across their local beach to say NO to filthy fossil fuels and YES to clean energy. We may have been victorious in preventing new offshore drilling sites along the Atlantic Coast but seismic airgun testing is still a tremendous threat!


Seismic testing searches for oil and gas deposits deep below the ocean floor and has an extremely dangerous impact on whales, dolphins and many other sea creatures. 

Come out and be part of this event that sends a strong message to the world that we expect change and we expect it soon!

Saturday May 21st, 2016 | 11:30am | Beach between Lindell & Washington Avenue, Long Beach, NY. Head for the beach and look for the Surfrider banner.

Happy Hour afterwards at The Jetty nearby afterwards. Drink specials!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Surfrider banners on the beach
results.name: Hands Across The Sand

We'll be teaching:

results.description:
"Drawing Dialogues: Selections from the Sol LeWitt Collection" re-examines minimal and conceptual art and the parameters of the drawn medium through the  lens of one of its greatest practitioners.


With over 100 works by more than sixty artists, the show concentrates on minimal and conceptual drawing, from key figures like Mel Bochner, Hanne Darboven, Eva Hesse, and Lawrence Weiner. It also includes works by artists such as Alighiero Boetti, Jan Dibbets, Kazuko Miyamoto, and Fred Sandback that investigate mark-making in unexpected materials and formats. In addition to exploring cross-connections among LeWitt’s peers, the exhibition presents contributions by older artists whose methods inspired LeWitt, as well as younger artists whose approaches are in dialogue with earlier generations while extending the medium in new directions. Finally, the exhibition features select works by LeWitt himself.

Admission is $5.  Here's a link to the exhibit:

http://www.drawingcenter.org/en/drawingcenter/5/exhibitions/

Since the Drawing Center doesn't open until noon, people might want to snack beforehand.  Thus, our meetup point will be Harney & Sons Fine Teas (Broome St near Crosby), where you may purchase light bites & of course coffee/tea.

After gathering, we will head out to the Drawing Center, which is nearby at 35 Wooster St. between Broome & Grand.

After the LeWitt exhibition, if people are interested, we might have 2 optional stops as long as we're in the neighborhood:  "New York Earth Room" and "Broken Kilometer" (both free)


http://www.diaart.org/sites/main/earthroom

http://www.diaart.org/sites/main/brokenkilometer

If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet inside cafe.  I will display a red Meetup sign.
results.name: See Highlights from the Sol LeWitt Collection at the Drawing Center in SoHo

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Our last visit to Pangea was sooo tasty we have decided to go again! (also this will be the last chance to go with us before this temporary restaurant closes forever! The Culinary Institute of American is recognized as one of the leading Culinary Schools in the world!  With alumni like Anthony Bourdain, Todd English, Rocco DiSpirito and Micheal Mina it speaks for itself.  Overlooking the Hudson Valley and river in Hyde Park, New York, it is one of the most amazing dining experiences you will ever experience!  Join us for this special day where you will enjoy a delicious dinner, wine tastings at a great local winery and the walkway across the hudson!  We will dine at the all new Pangea Restaurant.

Your day will begin with the beautiful train ride up the Hudson River on the Metro North Rail Road to Poughkeepsie where your guide will pick you up and  chauffeur you to all the days destinations.  You may also drive and meet the group at Poughkeepsie Train Station. First we will go to a local winery where you will sample some wonderful wines, following the winery you will visit The Walkway Over The Hudson Park for the most spectacular views of the Hudson Valley, finally we will go to Culinary institute of America where you will enjoy one of the most amazing Culinary experiences that you will ever have!

What to wear:  Neat casual and comfortable.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will likely be coming on their own.

$95  includes: Transportation from train to all activities and back, choice of appetizers, first course, main course, sides, desserts, coffee, tea, one beer, wine or soft drink,  ALL TAXES AND TIPS. Tasting fee at one winery included.

*** MUST PRE-PAY TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT ***

About Pangea

At Pangea we create cuisine with unique flavors and an urban flair. Pangea’s plant-forward offerings and thoughtful use of meats and seafood reflect today’s desire to protect our food resources while eating absolutely deliciously. We believe that dining should be a global adventure you share with friends right in your own neighborhood. So come in and rediscover Pangea.

Menus (choose 4 items from the list below)

Savory

Chipotle, Pecan, Sweet Potato Soup

Pressed Tomato Sushi Roll, Parsnip “Rice”

Roast Rutabaga, Thyme, Bacon

Warm Potato and Pastrami Salad

Goat Cheese, Wine Braised Carrot, Chestnut

Cauliflower, Orange Glaze, Refried Sticky Rice

Ruby Beet Tartare, Herbed Madeleines

Oxtail, Truffle and Mushroom Pie

Smoked Haddock, Kale Salad, Lime Yogurt

Roasted Vegetable Stew, Couscous, Almonds

Market Fish in Shiitake-Seaweed Broth

Cast Iron Cornish Game Hen, Pan Juices

Sweet

Molten Dark Chocolate Cup, Black Olive, Fennel Ice Cream

Poached Pear, Cardamom and Saffron

Lemon Polenta Pistachio Cake

White Chocolate Mousse Orange, Carrots

Whiskey Marmalade Chia Rice Pudding

Bleu Cheese, Oat Biscuit, Frozen Grapes

You will take the 11:43am train to Poughkeepsie.  You should be back on the 7:54 train to Grand Central
results.name: Culinary Institute of America Dinner, Wine Tasting, Hudson Walkway: Pangea

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson the first D&D 5E Module!

The Sword Coast is under siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

Players of all walks, new and old, are always welcome. Please feel free to comment if you have any questions.
results.name: D&D 5E: Hoard of the Dragon Queen

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you want to energize after a long work day

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music

- if you think fitness doesn't mean just lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our other BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

results.description:
Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer, and at the same time meet fun new people and make some new friends, during our private tour and pre-mingle! 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Apr-02-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid). We will introduce you to the other members attending and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at $55.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $59.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Apr-02-2016_at_1200PM

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +25? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 50 members attending and this will sell out!

PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Apr-02-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Join us to play epic acoustic songs on Acoustic Guitars! Ukeleles, Percussion, Upright Bass and Singers are welcome!

We will be working on finger style and acoustic technique as well as building a nice repertoire for Summertime.

This group will meet primarily at this location (353 W 48th St) but also outdoors at the park (TBA).

Setlist include:

Hotel California

Harvest Moon

Wild Horses

Give a Little Bit

Hey There Delilah

Wish You Were Here

Summer Breeze

and a few more...

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles, Blues Rock and Brazilian Guitar Ensembles, now it's time for Acoustic Jams!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 


To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (charts will be up by 05/05)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!
results.name: Acoustic Jams Ensemble

group.name: The New York City Social Group (12,000+ members!)

venue.name: New York Public Library Science Industry and Business Library

results.description:
Summer is coming. You have your priorities and they involve the out of doors and water. And yet, there is that little voice at the back of your head saying: "Maybe I should be looking for work. I know I need a job and come the fall I will really want to be working . . ."

Why not do both? Summer is a time when many people take time to enjoy themselves and work slows down and yet September is one of the biggest hiring months. For those in their own business, clients may not be buying in summer, but summer is the time to develop relationships. Not all career preparation has to be in a business suit. You can make your exploration compelling for yourself and for others. Join us as coach Win Sheffield shows how to make the most of your summer search and leave ample opportunity for recreation. You will learn ways to make more progress with less effort and feel better about your time off knowing you have done what you can for yourself and your career.
results.name: Summer Career Management: How to Invest in Your Career and Still Have Time Off

results.description:
You should be dancing Studio host the special workshop.

The day will begin with an intro workshop great for the beginner to pre-intermediate dancer and those who have no experience. Come get your feet wet and stick around for the second workshop where the material will be pushed up a notch. The third workshop is designed for those with at least 4 months of swing/lindy experience, as this will show you how to mix basic balboa patterns into your swing repertoire.

Here is the glimpse of Balboa dance.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NjWQgLsyggI


12- 1:30p: intro to bal

1:45 - 3:15p : Beyond the Basics

3:45 - 5:15p : Balboa to Swing Choreo

Pricing : In Advance : $30 per workshop, $40 for 2 workshops, $60 for all 3 workshops

Day of : $30 per workshop, $50 for 2 workshops, $70 for all 3 workshops.

Please, call the studio for more information. Please, mention balboa workshops with Yurina Shin.

Call to register :[masked] or online at www.youshouldbedancing.nyc
results.name: Balboa Workshops

results.description:
Alright guys, this is the last I'll scheduling at least for the moment. This is probably one of the toughest hikes I've done at the reservation, but not terrible, and it's got great views and a reservoir to dip your toes in and swim a little depending on the weather, if that's your thing. I figured I'd make it a couple months from now so you guys could prepare (aka shed any hibernation pounds) for it. I couldn't find a link for this trail online, but it's a pretty straight-forward loop. We'll start on the Orange (Schuber) trail and follow it to the end, which will take us to a really nice overlook. At about that point, the trail turns into Yellow Silver, and we will take that back down until it meets back up with the Orange, near the reservoir.

I would say this hike is moderate, with some steep parts, and about 8-9 miles. We will be hiking at about 2-3 miles/hour, or more depending on how fast we can go, as we'll be back around 3. Please make sure you can go at least 2 miles/hour, as I work in the afternoon, and make sure you've got a good pair of hiking boots, and 2-3 liters of water. If we have time, we will stop for a quick bite to eat at the Mason Jar afterwards.

Hope to see some of you there! :)
results.name: Noon O' Clock Hiking Series: Ramapo Reservation and Mason Jar

results.description:
Do you like hanging with the cool kids, making interesting decisions and sipping on drinks as you do it?  Then you're invited!  Join us as we nerd-out collectively with light, fun board and card games.  This will be a standard edition of our monthly meetup--an all day celebration of dice, cardboard and unique shared experiences with good people! 

Our Tabletop Day meetup will feature a large bearded man (let's call him Bill) with a bag full of games for good boys and girls to play.  All you'll need is a fun, competitive spirit and a $3 donation for the Impact Network (learn more here).  Regulars and myself will happily and patiently explain these games to anyone who joins. If games are underway when you arrive, get a drink, grab a chair and sidle up to a group in progress. A new game will no doubt be starting soon. 

“But” you say “you guys play games I've never heard of. They must be long and complex.”  Not really.  Admittedly we don't play party games but we do play mostly light, family-friendly modern games.  If you've ever been turned off by an endless Monopoly game or the utter randomness of Uno, you'll like what game designers have been up to lately.  Certainly no disrespect to those trailblazing games but modern games have taken their ideas and distilled them into potent, streamlined experiences that play in a relatively short time with easy rules. In particular, our meetup plays games that encourage socializing, fragile partnerships and everyone’s favorite, lying!

Wait, so you're not playing Scrabble, Clue or Charades?  No, sorry, we're doing something a little different.  Be sure to check out many of the other board game meetups featured on Friends and Neighbors.  Plenty of people playing Taboo, Clue, Connect Four and many of the perennial party favorites there.

What will we play?  Here's an overview of our Meetup's favorite game: The Resistance Avalon!  (If you don't follow, don't worry--I love explaining this game anyway.)

https://vimeo.com/165912969

“But Bill” you might say, “Noon? Really?” I know, it's super early for a Saturday but we'll be there for at least seven hours so show up whenever your bedroom stops spinning and you can comfortably handle  the thought of beer.  

Now, I do want to mention one thing that is important, though this has never been an issue.  My games are my babies.  So, like any good parent, I'm highly protective of them--especially my favorites (don't tell them I have favorites).  Please treat the games well. Don't bend the cards and be mindful of drinks and food. Also, we've created a culture of gracious winners and losers so remember the games are all in good fun.  Lastly, rules are harder to explain then you might think so be patient with the anyone trying.

And for those experienced gamers, the emphasis at this event will be on gateway and family weight games for a beginner-friendly experience. That said, feel free to bring your copy of The Cones of Dunshire--just don't push it on less experienced gamers. 

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!

results.description:
Thought upon seeing an event focused on family treasures at the museum that it might be interesting to twin with a museum visit. Description of family history event (which we will follow with checking out museum exhibits)

MOCAFAMILY: Family Treasures

Wonder how to keep your grandma’s teacup in tact? What about your uncle’s family album or sister’s ticket stubs? Join us for an afternoon of hands-on workshops, preservation tips, and family stories! Learn how to save, store, and share your family heirlooms, photographs, and digital memories. Connect with conservators and museum specialists; document family and neighborhood histories; digitize items of historical and cultural significance; and keep your treasures safe for generations to come! Activities for the whole family.

results.name: VISIT to MOCA (Museum of Chinese in America)

results.description:
We are inviting all of New York and beyond in the beauty and natural hair community to celebrate the beauty of women of color. 

Hue embraces women of color and celebrates amazing brands and businesses that offer products from the beauty industry. Hue will be the first large scale beauty and natural hair expo outside of Manhattan.

With three areas to shop, experience and learn and listen you will have a top notch experience!

Over 30 brands and businesses as vendors and sponsors and 3 top womenprenuers as presenters.

International Natural Hair Meetup Day (INHMD) is an annual one-day event whose purpose is to allow an opportunity for women worldwide to meet in their own communities while networking, sharing, and virtually meeting other women participating in same day meetups cross country and continents! Natural hair meetups are events designed to inform, share, inspire, and aid individuals in their natural hair journey. This will be Natural Partners in Crime 2nd time as hostess (2014).

INHMD Cares encourages you, the attendees to participate in bringing items for the Blessing Bags. Blessing Bags are for the Homeless. We ask attendees to bring travel size toiletries to be given to a local New York homeless shelter or center. For more details on INHMD Care please go to: http://nnhmd.com/inhmdcares/

results.description:
Good Morning!

Finally it's nice enough out to have this picnic. It's a great excuse to put some sneakers on and come meet some people. Feel free to bring friends and family, as there will be music, food and drink to share. Babies and pets welcome too!

For those that have never played I will teach you the game of Pétanque - the French cousin of Bocce. It involves throwing metal balls on a long sand court. Here's a video. I'll also have an ultimate disc.

According to the weather map there's no rain expected in our part of Brooklyn. The McCarren Bocce courts are located at the corner of Union & Bayard Street, or you can map Urban Rustic at 236 N 12th Street (restaurant across street).

If you can, please bring food or drink to share. We will not be grilling, just eating, drinking and playing in a chill spot next to the courts. For early arrivers and late comers, I will be setting up around 11:30am and breaking down starting at 2:30pm.

Hope to see you!

Damien

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
Hey, they got the Cook back. I'm having a Quesadilla! Please sign up if you think you may come. You can always change your mind. 

Southbound Cafe owner Barbara and Mike the barman have invited us to come back and play in open mic format. Meetup is held in the dining area for a nice, relaxed setting. Beer is cold and Quesadilla’s are very good! 

Come, have some fun! Last time, we had more newcomers and all we could have used was some more players. This is acoustic instruments only. One tiny amp and mic. Many don't even use that.

Great venue for first timers or more seasoned musicians trying out new stuff. Supportive and Judgement Free Zone!


Look forward to seeing you there.

-David/Zelmo

results.description:
We have our Naach Xpress class in JC on Saturday at noon. And you might be wondering isn't this time early to go to Hookah Bar? But at Bfunk we like to do things differently. This Naach Xpress class we are moving and grooving to the song "Hookah bar" from the movie Khiladi 786. So get ready to have a great workout session with some fun moves!

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it!


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g&feature=youtu.be

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

results.description:
Dharma Gentle & Level I
Saturday May 21, 12pm - 1:30pm

Om Namah Sivaya!

I'm thrilled to announce that Dharma Gentle Yoga classes start at the North Hudson Park! Have you thought about starting yoga, but were not sure what class would be right?

Or are you recovering from an injury? Or do you have back or neck pain?

Or maybe you just want to relax and renew after a long week!

Dharma Gentle is perfect for you, and may be just what you have been looking for!

This healing session is appropriate for all ages, who wish to finally add the healing qualities of yoga into their lives. We move the body through the classical poses very slowly, gently and conscientiously. Rests are taken between poses as the body moves towards inner introspection on a physical and meditative level. This class is highly beneficial for those returning from an illness or injury, or who haven’t moved in a long time. It is recommended for those who are looking for a gentle class. Everyone will leave feeling refreshed and relaxed. Register NOW and join us this Saturday. Relax and refresh!

Please share with your friends and feel free to invite them! :)

We look forward to see you on the mat for this beautiful relaxing class!

Lot's of love from my heart to yours.

Namaste, Burcu Gokcek *Pls DO NOT forget your Yoga mats.

(Dharma Gentle will prepare you for Dharma Level I)

..................................................................................................

***Donation: You may donate what ever comes from your heart! Your donations help us to offer more effordable yoga classes. ......................................................................................

*** Please arrive at least 5 minutes before start. We are goint to meet in front of the stone house by the lake!

* PleaseDO NOT eat anything before the practice. Yoga should done on an empty stomach.

..............................................................................................
Like us on Facebook and follow the announcements!

link: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hatha-Raja-Yoga-with-Burcu-Gokcek/351314568364431?ref=bookmarks

...........................................................................................

What is Dharma Yoga?

Dharma Yoga is a graceful, yet challenging form of yoga based on Sri Dharma Mittra’s almost fifty years of practice of classical yoga. The practice is appropriate for students of all levels, from beginner to lifelong practitioners and accessible to so many because it meets each student where they are and according to their condition. As students move through the different series, they are encouraged to go deeper and experience the practice in a meditative and spiritual way. Sri Dharma’s passion for helping students go deeper in their practice using only the best and most efficient techniques with the ultimate goal of Self-realization (gaining absolute knowledge of the True Self) is reflected in all aspects of the Dharma Yoga system.

Dharma Yoga has roots in all nine forms of yoga, including Hatha, Raja, Karma, Kriya, Bhakti, Japa, Laya and Jnana, as well as a focus on the Eight Limbs of Yoga (Patanjali’s Ashtanga Yoga) with great emphasis placed on Yama and Niyama. Sri Dharma was given an extraordinary gift of knowledge in receiving yoga directly from his Guru, Sri Swami Kailashananda a.k.a. Yogi Gupta, for over a decade beginning in the early 1960′s. During this period of intense study, Sri Dharma was exposed to various yoga techniques that he has refined over an almost half century of practice and teaching into the Dharma Yoga he and his certified teachers the world over continue to share with their students each day.

In essence, Dharma Yoga is a system of classical Hatha-Raja Yoga. A devotional practice that emphasizes good health, a clear mind and a kind heart. The method weaves together many teachings in order to bring all students closer to the goal of Self-realization.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the United Palace theater then to 178th street and walk over the bridge on the pedestrian pathway which has nice views of the Hudson river and all of the city and NJ. We have to walk in single file if there are bikes around, as bikes and pedestrians share the path

Once over the bridge we'll turn North and head up the Long Path in the Palisades Interstate Park. for about 4 miles through Allison Park and then descend to riverside where we can have our lunch break. There are great views here of the Hudson River, bridge and north part of Manhattan. After lunch we will hike back at the river level and then walk the trail up again to the GWB which we will cross to return to Manhattan. Things to add:

Be on time. We will wait for 10-15 before heading over bridge. Stragglers will be responsible for catching up. Please bear in mind if you don't like walking, this probably wouldn't be the best meet-up for you. This will be around 7-8 miles, and take us maybe 4-5 hours all in all, at at relaxed pace. Bring water (at least 1-2 quarts) Pack a lunch and snacks. You don't need hiking shoes but you should have sneakers with a good arch.

And just in case here is my cell[masked] 2767.

results.description:
Hello everyone this is going to be the third annual That Queens Race. This will be a push race though Queens. The start will be at Springfield Gardens High School and finish at Queens borough Community College. You can take the E train, Z train or the J train to Jamaica center and take the Q 85 bus straight to the high school where the race will start. You can also take the F train and transfer to the E train to Jamaica center. I look forward to seeing you all at the race and feel free to ask me any questions. We will have a hippie jump contest after as well a sprint race. I look forward to seeing you all there. Helmets and safety gear are highly recommended ride at your own risk.
(If you are interested in sponsoring this event or if you just want to help out please let know you can contact me through face book or thorough my email which is [masked] Rain date: Sunday May 22 12pm

results.description:
Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer, and at the same time meet fun new people and make some new friends, during our private tour and pre-mingle! 

Get tickets here - https://goo.gl/leVcjQ

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid). We will introduce you to the other members attending and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at $55.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $59.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://goo.gl/leVcjQ

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +25? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 50 members attending and this will sell out!

PREPAY HERE - https://goo.gl/leVcjQ
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date

results.description:
March winds and April showers bring forth May flowers.... fried chicken, and a whole host of more delectable soul food. It's official - my favorite food event of 2015 - Harlem Eat-Up - is back and hopefully better than ever.  

For those who haven't heard, last year Harlem Eat-up kicked off its inaugural festival in celebration of the culinary history of Harlem. Similar to last year - and the Food and Wine Festival in October, there will be exclusive dinners featuring reknown chefs, talks, cooking demostrations, and more. 

My personal favorite event from last year was "The Stroll" which has been extended into a two-day event - one on Saturday and Sunday. 

This meet-up will be for the Saturday event, but I highly encourage you to buy tickets for the "Sunday Stroll" if you are unable to attend on Saturday. It's worth it.

If you are able to attend on Saturday, we will be meeting at 12:15PM at a location near Morningside Park. Don't forget to buy your tickets early as the event will likely sell out. You can purchase tickets here ($80 + fees).

As the event gets closer, we'll be reaching out to the attendees to confirm attendance and organize a group meeting spot/location. For those coming, come on prepared - it's a 5 hour event and I was STUFFED last year after only 90 minutes into it.

results.description:
As featured by ABC News and Time Out, our Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL FUN! The theme of this hunt will be about sports (New York Sports teams and sports in general).

A series of clues will lead your team around New York City. You'll experience the excitement of being part of a team that solves clues & faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line. 

You can come alone and be placed on one of our teams or you can sign up with friends. It is a great way to connect meet new friends or connect with old ones. 

Each member of the winning group receives a gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

*GET TICKETS HERE

*Must Purchase Tickets In Advance (Tix NOT sold at the door) 

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

*PREPAY HERE

*PREPAY ONLY EVENT ($25, price goes up as date gets closer)

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain! 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales and RSVP's from other groups, we will have at least 25 people attending. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP. Prepay at this link -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/May-21-2016_at_0130PM
results.name: Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Only)

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain! 

How many members will be attending? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on pre-sales and RSVP's from other groups, we will have at least 25 people attending. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP. Prepay at this link -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/May-21-2016_at_0130PM

results.description:
Whether you’re new to fitness or have been working out for years, NYC In Your 20s is offering New Yorkers of all shapes, sizes and abilities FREE workout motivation every Saturday at 12:30 PM for six weeks, starting April 16, 2016.

NYC In Your 20s is helping New Yorkers get beach body ready by hosting their first annual fitness classes.  Over the course of six weeks, certified fitness trainer and nutritionist Oscar Flores and fitness instructor Bakari Taylor guide students through a warm-up before blasting through a series of fun, high-low impact choreographed workouts.  Suitable for people of all levels and free for everyone.  Sense of humor and flexible workout clothing required!

results.description:
Volunteer to help us showcase our free youth tennis program with the community before the season begins on May 28.

The purpose of our Play Days is to drum up excitement and registration for our 2016 season. We will have music, food, and tennis games and prizes! And it's a great way to experience the different sites. Please feel free to sign up for as many Play Days as you want, regardless of what site you normally attend. We want to make a scene!

Please officially register here for the Sumner Play Day and for any others you are interested in.
results.name: Pre-Season Play Day at Sumner

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: C&B sets aside space for us from 12:30pm to 2:30pm so those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer if they wish.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at C&B, you will have to take a lesson from the range staff. If you are an experienced archer, you must at least stay for the safety portion (no exceptions, range rules). Lessons start at half past the hour so if you miss the 12:30pm, you may have to sit around and wait for the 1:30pm. Please be on time.

Public Transportation: LIRR to Hicksville and then a taxi from the station to C&B (make sure to tell them 11 Commercial St in Hicksville). The train from Penn gets into Hicksville at 11:55 am. The one-way cab rate as of 1/1/16 is roughly $6.30 (http://www.worldtaximeter.com/new-york/hicksville+train+station/440+jericho+turnpike%2C+hicksville) +$2 for each additional person. Those of you taking the train may wish to post a message to the group to share a cab.

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rates:

$7.00 for the first hour, $5 each additional hour OR $15 to shoot all day
$1.00 for a target
$11 per hour for a rental bow and arrows
$5.00 for a lesson (includes first hour)

Visit the C&B website for the most up-to-date information.

See you on the shooting line!
results.name: Monthly Meetup at C&B Archery

group.name: New York City/Long Island Archery Group

results.description:
Ok Everyone , 

 The weather man says Rain this weekend so indoors we go ,But that doesn't mean we won't have fun . Join me at the hudson river museum  starting at 12:30  we  will wait in lobby  . then head out to tour this great little local gem  $6 gets you in  to museum to see the newest showing  of art by  Juan  Bernal =pure and simple exhibit, they also have  a beautiful collection of artist  that call the hudson valley their home . as well as a beautiful victorian house tour. come start your day with a little learning at the museum  then at  1.30  we will head downtown to the Yonkers Brewing co.  92 Main street  (right next to overpass for metro north =with waves on it )  parking there  is meters  or garage around the corner  . They will give a free tour and tell you how they make their beers @ 2pm so don't be late !  we will split up into small groups to grab a bite to eat   their brunch items are DELISH .. I will circulate  among the tables to check on you . This is a pay your own way event you pay for what you eat & drink  please remember  to drink responsibly . Come make some friends this weekend
results.how_to_find_us: wait in lobby
results.name: Art and Brunch - Yonkers style

results.description:
This will be the 10th commencement of the dance parade (down Broadway) and festival in Tompkins square park. It will be a joyous, only in New York afternoon. Save the date.   In the meantime.. go to their websites online and in face book to learn more about this venue.

I assume that you have been  on line and found more information about "dance parade" .  Let us meet between 1:30 / 1:45  -  a little above the S.W. corner of University Place and 10th Street (between 10th and 11th street {but closer to 10th Street.})    This spot is right before the parade turns the corner and preforms in front of their grand stand.  From there .......  the parade goes down 8th street and into Tompkins Square Park.

  Look for me wearing my ORANGE HEADBAND.

 Once inside the park....... our hang out spot will be inside the playground opposite the dog run.......(.East of the women's rest room.)         If you looked at their diagram of the Park Venue.... I am speaking of stage "C".  This is near  the corner of Ave B  and 10th Street.  Facing the stage..... we will congregate on the left  hand side of the stage.  This is their stage of rotating DJ's ......and public,  everybody invited dancing......  Of course we are free to come and go as we please.... There is so much going on  ...You do your thing.... ...... But,     we do have an official hang out spot.

I hope the weather is good because this Parade goes on..... " Rain , or Shine".
results.name: DANCE  PARADE  AND  FESTIVAL

results.description: Hi all, so Saturdays has ALSO become popular and so I have to cap the attendance at 24 people only. Be diligent about showing up on time and if change your mind to "no" please change your attendance or else I will hold you accountable and bar you after 3 times of being a "no-show". If you do not RSVP and we're full before 1 pm, you will not be included in the game. It is important that we have an accurate attendance as team size and other people showing up are dependent upon RSVPs. Any questions please private message me.

<a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/makersquare-interview-prep-tickets-25333268488?aff=meetup">http://www.eventbrite.com/e/makersquare-interview-prep-tickets-25333268488?aff=meetup

Looking to join the MakerSquare immersive program, but need help studying for the technical interview? We've made a workshop just for you!

The goal of this workshop is to drill down on functional programming in JavaScript.

We'll be working through some practice problems to reinforce concepts like:

• JavaScript syntax

• Basic functions

• Callbacks and higher order functions

Join us to get started on your path of becoming a software engineer!
results.how_to_find_us: Head east on 30th at the intersection of 30th and Broadway
results.name: MakerSquare Interview Prep

results.description:
Curvy Girls,

It's Spring and its time to come out of our shell!  Let's learn pole dancing together this month!  Ready to have great fun and go for drinks afterwards?

If the thought of another hour on the treadmill makes you cry with boredom, let's do something a little more exotic—pole dancing classes. NYC is the place to be for the coolest classes!

Where else but a pole dancing studio could you take classes in both yoga and lap dancing? Our special class offers both, along with a large array of pole classes, of course. Our class teaches you a surprising amount of moves in the span of an hour or two, and the classes are among the best deals in the city. 

If you’re really brave, you can even perform your routines in a recital.

Let's do this Curvy Girls Style!

Love,

venue.name: Shu Swamp Nature Preserve, Charles T. Church Preserve

results.description:
Ok all of you Methusala-loving, bark-eating tree huggers, this is for you!  Celebrate spring with a nature walk through one of the finest old-growth forest preserves on Long Island. 

Supposedly the tallest tree in NYS is on the Northeast side of the Park.  And, somewhere in the Park is a 600 year old tree.  They don't publicize these much due to vandalism, etc....how horrible.  Between now and then, I'll study how to spot one & contact the LI Botanical Society - there's more than just size involved here.  The Old Tjikko tree in Sweden is 9,550 years old and 16' tall.

"A tree grows in Mill Neck -- and it's the tallest in the state, according to a local naturalist.  The specimen -- a slender tulip tree just outside the northeastern border of Shu Swamp Nature Preserve -- stretches high into the sky, disappearing in a canopy of lush leaves. It is 167 feet tall, according to Daniel Karpen, a Huntington engineer, environmental consultant and inventor -- more than eight feet taller than the state's current tallest recorded tree."

SHU SWAMP, MILL NECK 
These White Ash trees are some of the oldest on Long Island at up to 600 years old. Known as one of the most spectacular old growth forests in the eastern United States, it has 2.5 miles of trails and boardwalks. 

A little reading:  http://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/16/nyregion/nyregionspecial2/16colli.html?_r=0

A 200 year old Copper Beech tree that had Landmark Status near my property just died - that got me thinking about this once again.  By the way - their lifespan is[masked] years, and a very few have reached 300 years.  Four European Beech trees (European Copper and Plum -- these were imported from Europe) were planted in 1820  to commemorate the landing of the Pilgrims, and two still survive here around the Lake....and oh my, they are majestic and beautiful. 

About the nearly 5,000 year old Methusala, but we're not in the high Sierra's, but hopefully we'll find the Long Island "Methusala":  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methuselah_(tree)  It's considered one of the world's oldest organisims.  

Spend some time researching all of this, and post info in comments.  The 600 year old tree is either a White Ash or a Tupelo... we'll have to figure out what those are in advance HAHA.  

Hug a tree, it may not be there tomorrow...I can't believe the one by me has died...so sad to see.  https://www.arborday.org/ A link to the Arbor Society.  YES, I had 5 trees cut on my property this past year...sad, but they needed to go.  The site helps you make good choices on where and what to plant.  I've always made it a practice to celebrate a birth, or a death, with a tree - the world needs more of a good thing & there is joy when you watch it grow.

About Shu Swamp:  http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g48173-d3344588-Reviews-Shu_Swamp_Preserve_Charles_T_Church_Nature_Preserve-Mill_Neck_Long_Island_New_York.html

After, we'll grab something to eat...maybe in Bayville on the water??
results.name: In Search of a 600-year-old Tree & NY States Tallest Tree

results.description:
This is a repost from a Facebook Event Page, please join the fb page to stay updated on this event:  https://www.facebook.com/events/872671262849331/

GRO is an organization for girls by girls. At the heart of the GRO Mission is showing girls, of all ages, just how amazing and capable they are. Every girl can be a leader and make a positive impact on the world. Chica de Mayo is one beautiful example of this.

At 9 years old, Zoe, from GRO NYC, had a vision and an idea to help bring girls from both skateboarding and long boarding together, and to teach some new girls to ride too.

“Skateboarding is my life. I love to cruise around on my longboard and I love hitting the skateparks on my trick board. Dropping in on a big hill or ramp makes me feel like I am flying! My idea is to have an event that brings skateboarding girls and long boarding girls together. The Brooklyn Bike Park is the perfect place for that because it’s good for both kind of boards. It has a really long track with little hills which is fun for trick boards or longboards. I think an event like this is good because it will bring all kinds of girls together and when girls get together we can encourage each other and great things can happen!”
– Zoe

Chica de Mayo was conceived and will be lead by Zoe with the help of the GRO NYC Crew. This event will include…

Learn To Skate Workshop
Girls Only Skate Session
Fun Contests
Raffle
Live DJ
And More!

Sponsors and product donors can help make Chica de Mayo a great success through financial contributions, product donations for raffle and contest prizes, or through food and beverage sponsorship of this event. To get involved email [masked] today!

Save The Date!
Saturday, May 21st
results.name: Chica de Mayo

results.description:
From Goodreads--
"Who are you? you must be wondering. I am your soulmate, your old friend, and I have come back to this city of sixteen million in search of you.

So begins the first letter that falls into Wang’s lap as he flips down the visor in his taxi. The letters that follow are filled with the stories of Wang’s previous lives—from escaping a marriage to a spirit bride, to being a slave on the run from Genghis Khan, to living as a fisherman during the Opium Wars, and being a teenager on the Red Guard during the cultural revolution—bound to his mysterious “soulmate,” spanning one thousand years of betrayal and intrigue.

As the letters continue to appear seemingly out of thin air, Wang becomes convinced that someone is watching him—someone who claims to have known him for over one thousand years. And with each letter, Wang feels the watcher growing closer and closer…

Seamlessly weaving Chinese folklore, history, and literary classics, The Incarnations is a taut and gripping novel that sheds light on the cyclical nature of history as it hints that the past is never truly settled."

The final tally from the poll and the March Meetup

The Incarnations--14

Purple Hibiscus--6

Satantango--6
results.name: May -- The Incarnations by Susan Barker

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

IF YOU DON'T LIKE TO STOP IN A NUMBER OF ARTIST STUDIOS, LOOK AT THE ARTWORK, OR TALK TO THE ARTISTS, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU. WE'LL BE WALKING ABOUT 3 1/2 MILES AT A MODERATE PACE. YOU WILL ALSO HAVE PLENTY OF TIME TO SOCIALIZE WITH OTHERS. 

I also have scheduled the same walk on Sunday, May 22nd.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo.

Description: Now in its 16th year, SONYA (South of the Navy Yard Artists) artists will open their doors to the public and show their work. The art walk will be in four vibrant Brooklyn neighborhoods: Fort Greene, Clinton Hill, Wallabout, and Bedford-Stuyvesant. Some of these artists didn't participate last year. The artists don't charge admission to their art studios. We'll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view the artists' working environment. We can talk to the artists about what they do. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, and printmaking.

We'll also be walking down streets with beautiful Antebellum and Victorian townhouses and free-standing Gilded Age mansions of a scale rarely seen in NYC. Occasionally, some of these art studios will be located inside these lovely houses.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.   

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the side entrance to the Atlantic Terminal Mall in Brooklyn, NY. This side entrance is on the right side of the Mall, which has the spacious plaza with the metal benches. This side entrance is next to the Guitar Center Store. This side entrance is also right across the street from the front entrance to the Barclay Center Arena. 

Before the walk, restrooms are available in the Target Department Store in the Atlantic Terminal Mall. These restrooms are located upstairs in Target near the cashiers.

Below is the side entrance of the Atlantic Avenue Mall with the Guitar Center to the right.

Transportation Options: Take the D, N, Q, R , 2, or 4 subway train to Atlantic Avenue. You can also take the LIRR to Atlantic Avenue. The Atlantic Avenue/Pacific Street station has many subway platforms, stairways, and tunnels, so allow extra time to get to the meeting place. The Atlantic Terminal Mall is above the subway trains and LIRR.

Finishing Time/Place: The circular walk will finish between 5:00 PM and 5:15 PM back at the Atlantic Terminal Mall.

Only heavy rain or rain with windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain or rain with windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning (before 10:30 AM). If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.)

Below are airbrushed stencil works by Chris Davis.

Below are unusual sculptures by Doug Beube.

Below is a painting by Masud Masud.

Below are paintings by Jamal Ince.

 Below is textile design by Atiya Jones

Below is sculpture titled "The Lovers" by Rachel Selekman.

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.
