results.description:
Who is asking these questions ?

You and others who read this.

Ok, Thanks a lot for that!

No problem, it's nice doing empathy.

Is this free or donation based class ?


it's a donation based class.

I kept the group completely free for two years and paid all the organizer dues out of my pocket. Meetup is not really helping me to give free classes or with organizer fees-And it's not small, believe me- 

So the classes will be donation based starting from 2016

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket.Feel free to post a message below and hopefully someone would have an extra mat. 

Should i ask the organizer if he can arrange extra mats for me ?

Seriously ?

Oh, OK.I'm sorry. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.


Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?


It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. Umit will be helping you with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice): 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26108446/
results.how_to_find_us: just get to the corner of 72nd and 5th. Take a close look at the benches on your left handside. We are there !!!

results.description:
Join us for our first English as a Second Language Event!  Calling by Susan Kevra and music by THE FREE RAISINS!  Enjoy English Country Dancing in the afternoon and a Contra Dance in the evening, set to the joyous tunes of this fabulously bilingual band! 

3:00-3:30 English Country Dance lesson - all are welcome!
3:30-6:00 English Country Dance to the grooves of the Free Raisins! 
6:00-7:30 dinner break 
7:30-8:00 Intro contra workshop for new dancers- all are welcome! 
8:00-10:45 Contra dance for all!

No partner or experience necessary! Please bring clean, soft-soled shoes and help us protect the floors. 

ADMISSION  (Go for two languages!)

One dance: $15 members/students, $18 non-members


Both dances: $20 members/students, $25 non-members

The FREE RAISINS are: 
Audrey Knuth on fiddle 
Amy Englesberg on piano, accordion 
Jeff Kaufman on mandolin, trumpet, feet 
http://www.freeraisins.com/


Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.  

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

results.description:
Hello Japanese learners! Lately I've been working on getting to know what each of you would like to work on in order to improve your Japanese.

I figured that I need more time to get some decent amount of people ready to gather around and do some actual meet-ups, so first I'm doing this small lecture for all the beginners. I'll be talking about how Japanese language can be learned by non-native speakers and also doing some pronunciation exercise.

For the intermediate & advanced learners, I'd like to get to know what you'd like to learn and expect me to teach! I've been teaching one-on-one lessons to many advanced level learners, and usually used some news articles for summarizing, responding and discussing, and also short novels to learn some flavorful expressions in Japanese.

My teaching style is essentially giving a lot of informations and options to my students, so they can build up their own identity in the language.  Especially Japanese has a tremendous variation of expressions, so it's very important to understand both Japanese culture and your own background to merge them into one solid identity.

I will be so looking forward to seeing and supporting all of you guys!

***Meet-Up Information***

Required to have: PayPal Account

Lecture Time: 15:05-15:55

Level: ★☆☆☆☆ (Very Beginning - Introduction)

Purpose & Contents: Getting to know some basic ideas of Japanese language and tips for learning it. Pronouncing all the Japanese sounds from Hiragana chart.

*Handouts will be prepared by the instructor.


Payment: Please submit a payment of $12.00 to '[masked]' on PayPal by May 19th 23:59. If you're booking after 19th, please submit before the meeting. *Payment will be refunded only if the meet-up gets canceled.

*Please check your message box constantly and stay responsive, otherwise members might get dismissed from this meet-up occasionally, since we have RSVP system in terms of payment and attendee limit.

*If we have less than 5 attendees by 10th 23:59, this meet-up will be held at Starbucks (600 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018). *Handouts will be prepared by the instructor.

*Every 4 meet-up attendances get you $10 discount for the instructor's private lessons (Skype & Meet-Up available).
results.name: Japanese Learning Tips & Hiragana Exercise [Level: ★☆☆☆☆]

results.description:
Note: This Is the St. Barts Location.

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315
results.name: St. Barts. #2 I won't drown Swim Challenge. SOLDOUT

results.description:
Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=JSEP5AQ6GAS44

=============================================

Though just twelve streets long and two avenues wide, West Chelsea is the premiere district for art galleries in New York City, with over 200. On this private tour we will visit up to 9 selected ones. Highlights will include exclusive talks by owners and staff that will give us greater insight into the exhibits.

As a bonus, we will also see some of the recently installed public art on the High Line. 

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM. 

IMPORTANT:

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=JSEP5AQ6GAS44

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor.

- On May 20 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- If space is available, payment can be made on-site ($25, cash only).

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, send "old-fashioned" text only to (917) 680-0656. This is not a smartphone and has no Internet access, so emailing, posting comments on this page, or sending messages through the Meetup site (or app) will NOT work. Also, no voice calls please, as they can be extremely disruptive.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed. And if you wish, download the free Snapchat app to your iPhone or Android and share your photos with family and friends.

- The tour will last approximately one and a half hours. Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- Gratuities are appreciated.

- Art novices are welcome, as are people with extensive art backgrounds.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees.

- Please note that the "+ xx" next to my name on the attendance list to the right is a count of total attendees from outside this group, manually updated every 12-48 hours.  It is NOT an arbitrary number. However, also remember that "no-shows" can never be accurately predicted.


See you there!

Milton & Savona

results.description:
I'm pretty excited about this and just know members from our group will find it valuable - it'll be fun, enlightening and very cool.  

Oh - this is limited to 20 people, so don't delay

                             Karaoke Empowerment


                   Unleash Your Inner Superstar

                   (even if you want to unleash it quietly)

Karaoke is exploding


……………………….and there’s good reason for it


Believe it or not EVERY human being has a deep desire to sing  


Yet many people hold themselves back from this joyful experience

What a terrible shame, because singing is one of the fundamental joys

Deep down, I believe we all want to sing.


In our younger days we dreamed of singing on stage to adoring fans.  As adults, we love to listen, hum or even sing to inspiring music - in the car, the shower and while doing chores.  Perhaps we join in song in a group setting.  


But wouldn’t it be great to pull off a great rendition of (fill in your favorite fantasy song here).  Wouldn’t that be amazing????


I know.......... you’ll say you can’t, but the truth is - you CAN.  


And regardless of what you’ve been led to believe - everyone, yes EVERYONE, can learn to sing.  


And just to overemphasize this a bit: Nope - sorry, you are not special.  You CAN SING.  Yes, I’m talking about you!


In this workshop, you will have the opportunity to learn how.  


Warning - you’ll get a lot more than karaoke skills here. At this workshop you’ll get inspiration for recreating your life as well.  


Need some reassurance?  No one will be forced to sing in front of the group BUT you will be given lots of chances.


Upon registration you’ll get my easy preparation method, which when followed, will teach you to “own” a song.


The guarantee:  You’ll get a method that works and an afternoon of fun.  PLUS, the afternoon will be followed by an optional dinner and evening out at a local karaoke club.


$35 - paypal link below


May 21, Saturday from 3 to 6 p.m. followed by optional dinner and meeting at a karaoke club for some practice

(This is taught by Gerri Ratigan - singer, life coach, dedicated to the value of every individual and having lots of fun.....)   

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=N56EN94W6E3JG

results.description:
Hello Frenchies,
Our brilliant member Roxane Revon strikes again, hitting the New York stage with one of the most popular French play "Le Dindon" written by Georges Feydeau.


At the 4th Street Theatre (East Village)

INFOS & TICKETS: https://ateliertheatreny.com/shows/

Wednesday May 18th at 8pm => SOLD OUT
Friday May 20th at 8pm =>SOLD OUT
Saturday May 21st at 3pm
=> tickets: :https://sorteer.com/events/le-dindon-de-feydeau-3/

Le Dindon est la pièce de Feydeau qui a connu le plus grand succès. Elle retrace les péripéties de Pontagnac, coureur invétéré de jupons, qui suit Lucienne jusque chez elle où il lui fait des avances. Soudain surgit le mari, qui n'est qu'autre que Vatelin, l'un de ses amis. Vatelin connaissant Pontagnac lui pardonne sa bravade. Tout pourrait en rester là, mais un évènement imprévu va semer la zizanie : Maggy, une ancienne maîtresse de Vatelin quand ce dernier était à Londres, débarque chez lui… Mise en scène de Roxane Revon

Avec : Marie Lintzer (Mme VATELIN) ● Brice Lefebvre-Parenty (M. PONTAGNAC)
Jessica Gourdon (Mme PONTAGNAC) ● Carl Héline (M. VATELIN)
Béatrice Thomas-Varini (ARMANDINE) ● Benjamin Nadal (M. REDILLON)
Virginie Truchot (Maggy SOLDIGNAC) ● Romain Liot (M. SOLDIGNAC)
Lucie Dupas (Mme PINCHARD) ● Pierre Quémard (M. PINCHARD)
Valérie Coutarel (La GERANTE / GEORGETTE) ● Romain Vanpeene (JEAN / le COMISSAIRE)
Margaux Feredj (Clara) ● Adrien Giotti (Victor)
results.name: Le Dindon de Georges Feydeau

results.description:
STATUS:  This event is ON. : )  Meetup outside Bryant Park Grill.  Look for Laurence by the table with a yellow table cloth.

Host:   Laurence & volunteers.  

Discuss Helen Fisher's research on personality type, brain chemistry, and attraction.

"Biological Anthropologist Helen Fisher studies the brain in love and shares with us her newest research about why we love who we love."  TEDxEast  https://youtu.be/fW6AndSUByo 

https://youtu.be/fW6AndSUByo

About Helen Fisher

"Anthropologist Helen Fisher studies gender differences and the evolution of human emotions. She's best known as an expert on romantic love, and her beautifully penned books — including Anatomy of Love and Why We Love — lay bare the mysteries of our most treasured emotion.Why you should listen

Helen Fisher's courageous investigations of romantic love -- its evolution, its biochemical foundations and its vital importance to human society -- are informing and transforming the way we understand ourselves. Fisher describes love as a universal human drive (stronger than the sex drive; stronger than thirst or hunger; stronger perhaps than the will to live), and her many areas of inquiry shed light on timeless human mysteries, like why we choose one partner over another.

Almost unique among scientists, Fisher explores the science of love without losing a sense of romance: Her work frequently invokes poetry, literature and art -- along with scientific findings -- helping us appreciate our love affair with love itself. In her research, and in books such as Anatomy of Love, Why We Love, and her latest work Why Him? Why Her?: How to Find and Keep Lasting Love, Fisher looks at questions with real impact on modern life. Her latest research raises serious concerns about the widespread, long-term use of antidepressants, which may undermine our natural process of attachment by tampering with hormone levels in the brain.

What others say

“In hands as skilled and sensitive as Fisher's, scientific analysis of love only adds to its magic.” — Scientific American"

http://www.ted.com/speakers/helen_fisher


Join us in Bryant Park for fresh air, sun, and conversation.  

Share your observations.   
--Greet old friends and meet new one.  

(***NOTE - This outdoor event is weather contingent. Please check back here after 8 a.m. on 5/21 for the final status before departing for this meetup.  Thank you.***)

Proposed Agenda

When you arrive, find Yen to get a name/type tag, and then go forth and mingle! 

3:00 pm     Watch  TEDTalk on my laptop 

3:30 pm    Introductions 

5:00+pm Formal end.  All are welcome to continue the conversation on your own. 

(Please note that Fisher is not scheduled to appear...only his video is scheduled. This event works like a book club, but the discussion topics are clips from <a>www.ted.com,</a> "Ideas Worth Spreading". ) 

(See photos of map of meetup location and tables outside Bryant Park Grill)


Meet real life examples of your personality type...this maybe how you come across to others! :D 

Meet others personality types and find out what they like or dislike about your "personality type's" patterns! :( 

Prerequisite: Take the online test and read your personality description. How well does your personality type description fit you? 

http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/JTypes2.asp 

ISTJ - Duty Fulfillers http://www.celebritytypes.com/istj.php 
ESTJ - Guardians        http://www.celebritytypes.com/estj.php 
ISFJ - Nurturers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfj.php 
ESFJ - Caregivers        http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfj.php 
ISTP - Mechanics http://www.celebritytypes.com/istp.php 
ESTP - Doers http://www.celebritytypes.com/estp.php 

ESFP - Performers http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfp.php 
ISFP - Artists http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfp.php 
ENTJ - Executives http://www.celebritytypes.com/entj.php 
INTJ - Scientists http://www.celebritytypes.com/intj.php 
ENTP - Visionaries http://www.celebritytypes.com/entp.php 
INTP - Thinkers http://www.celebritytypes.com/intp.php 
ENFJ - Givers  http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfj.php 
INFJ - Protectors        http://www.celebritytypes.com/infj.php 
ENFP - Inspirers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfp.php 
INFP - Idealists            http://www.celebritytypes.com/infp.php 


When you arrive, find Yen to get a name/type tag, and then go forth and mingle with other MBTI enthusiasts!


http://www.bryantpark.org/plan-your-visit/webcam.html 

In case of rain, we'll meetup in the Bank of America Atrium (corner of 42 St. and 6th Ave.).  See photo below.



About the Group Organizer: Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator & examiner in the public and private sector.  He is a "serotonin" type according to Helen Fisher's research. : )
results.name: Personality Type & Brain Chemistry - Helen Fisher's TEDx Video 'Biology of Mind'

venue.name: The LOFT: LGBT Community Services Center

results.description:
The LOFT: LGBT Community Center is partnering with the New Westchester Symphony Orchestra to present a special concert to kick off June being Pride Month.  A program of all LGBT composers will be performed. 

The concert will take place in the Sanctuary of Memorial United Methodist Church, upstairs from The LOFT in the same building. 

The concert  program will feature the following LGBT composers and selections.

Cole Porter - Cole Porter Classics

Leonard Bernstein - West Side Story Overture

Aaron Copland - Quiet City

Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky - Violin Concerto Movement II, Nicholas Pappone, Violin

Aaron Copland - At The River

Benjamin Britten - Simple Symphony Movement III

Aaron Copland - Hoe Down from Rodeo

Admission is free, donations are welcome
results.how_to_find_us: For directions, please go to www.loftgaycenter.org
results.name: Kick Off to Pride Concert Featuring LGBT Composers

results.description:
Summer on the Hudson & Kindred Arts create a family-friendly gathering of community, cultures, and music lovers of all ages, featuring Reggae, Soulful House, Disco, and Afro-Beat spun by a collection of North America's renowned sound architects.

Pack a lunch/ snack and spend the day in West Harlem Piers Park listening to DJs spin great sounds.  Visit the market for a new outfit or dinner and then dance through the sunset and into the night.

Here we will have countless opportunities for photos. We may even be able to get some of the sunset.

So come on out and join us and create photos to music.


Note: This is an event being held by the NYC Parks Dept. and it will be crowded. If you are late, we will start mingling without you.


Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!!

P.S. Remember to format your cards, charge your batteries and come with your enthusiasm to make new friends!

results.description:
WRITING helps us see who we really are - and better still, who we can grow to be.

This event is for EVERYONE, not just professionals and aspiring professionals.

We'll:

• Talk about techniques that can make our writing valuable for self discovery and social change.

• Recommend some of our favorite writers and writings.

• Do some writing ourselves, here and now.

• And, if you like, share some of what you write with the group for helpful feedback and encouragement. At least one professional writer will be present.

Please bring pen and paper and, if you like, samples of your writing you might like to share.

If you have any questions or trouble finding us, call me anytime at[masked] 9881. This event repeats monthly, usually same time 3rd Saturday each month.

I hope to see you there!
-Bill

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Sammy Social is a member of several social groups in the city.  One particular day Sammy attended several events, met with friends and toured some historic sites near Herald Square.  By the end of the night Sammy met a horrible fate and the police need your help to solve this case!   Join us for this fun night where you will join with other members of our group to set out on a mission to find clues to solve Sammy's case.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$10 in advance only - prepay here:

http://nysnmurdermyst.eventbrite.com

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


How it works:

-Arrive at the venue for socializing, cocktails and registration.

-If you don't have a team we will put you with other fun people in teams of 4-5.

-Once you are on a team you will receive a sheet retracing Sammy's steps that day.  You will go out into the neighborhood to find clues and fact that will help you solve Sammy's Case.  Along the way you will also learn a little NYC history!

-Each group will have 90 minutes to find as many clues and solve the case.  You will return to the bar  for more socializing, cocktails and food if you wish, while we tally up the scores.

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code?  Be comfortable but keep it neat.

What is included?  $10 includes admission to the hunt and drink specials at the bar.
results.name: The Great Midtown Murder Mystery Scavenger Hunt - Prepay Only

results.description:
Dear Friends,

Please join us at our next concert, full of wonderful musical talent and camaraderie!

OPENING COMMENTS

1.  Arabeske Op. 18- R. Schumann, La plus que lente- C. Debussy: Lorraine Fuchs (Piano) 

2.  Mazurka Op. 41, No. 2, in E minor, Mazurka Op. 67, No. 4, in A minor, Mazurka Op. 67, No. 2, in G minor, Mazurka Op. 7, No. 1, in B flat major- F. Chopin: Julia Lee (Piano)

3.  The Last Sunday- J. Petersburski, Tango en Skai- R. Dyens: Serena LaVine, Dick LaVine (Tango Dance)

4.  Two-Part Inventions: No. 8 in F Major, BWV 779, No. 13 in A Minor, BWV 784, No. 14 in B Flat Major, BWV 785- J.S. Bach: Dawn Tyrrell (Piano)

INTERMISSION

5.  Preludes Op. 11 (No. 4 in E minor, No. 5 in D major, No. 9 in E major, No. 10 in C sharp minor, No. 13 in G flat major)- A. Scriabin: Tatiana Viscun (Piano)

6.  Ah, non credea. . .  Ah, non giunge (from La Sonnambula)- V. Bellini: Molly Watson (Soprano), Gene Rohrer (Piano)

7.  Four Preludes: C major, E minor, G Sharp minor, E major- J. Svrcek: Justin Svrcek (Piano)

8.  Ave Maria- F. Schubert, Do not sing to me beautiful maiden- S. Rachmaninoff: Toshiko Jones (Piano), Elliot Niebch (Violin), Eduardo Tenenbaum (Cello), Veronica Kaninska (Soprano)

ACMA Concert Location Details:

DiMenna Center for Classical Music, Norman S. Benzaquen Hall (2nd Floor)
450 West 37th Street (between 9th and 10th Avenues), New York, NY 10018

If you have any questions regarding this event, please email me at [masked].

We will start as close to 4:00 p.m. as possible. Your punctuality is greatly appreciated.

Transportation

The DiMenna Center is conveniently located on 37th Street between 9th and 10th Avenues, within minutes of Port Authority, Penn Station, and Grand Central Station transportation hubs.

Subway:

A, C, E trains to 34th Street and 8th Avenue

1, 2, 3, LIRR trains to 34th Street and 7th Avenue

Bus:

N, R, Q, B, D, F, M trains to 34th Street and 6th Avenue

N, Q, R, S, 1, 2, 3, 7 trains to Times Square 42nd Street and 7th Avenue

M11 bus to 38th Street and 9th Avenue

M42 bus to 42nd Street and 10th Avenue

Contributions

We suggest a $5.00 contribution per person, to be directly applied towards payment of the hall rental. Contributions are voluntary, and any amount is greatly appreciated.

For Performers (Please read the Performance Tips page on the ACMA website):

What is the high point of your piece? Every musical and dramatic work takes its audience on a journey, generally consisting of the following elements:

1-) Introduction and elaboration: The central melodic theme is introduced and often repeated, in identical fashion or with variation. The mood of the piece is presented and established via use of dynamics, tempo and melodic arc.

The performer must draw in the audience at this point, either with a compelling narrative subtext, or strong emotional message. Also, the performer must build gradual tension (when applicable), leading the audience to the musical climax.

2-) Climax: The highest emotional point of the work, usually occurring 2/3 to ¾ into the piece. Requires maximum expression and melodic emphasis to evoke a desired reaction or response from the audience. Also considered a reward point, or tension release for the audience.

The performer should fully understand the climactic point of the piece, and clearly highlight this point via the use of tone, dynamic expression and musical touch. The importance of the climax for audience understanding and satisfaction cannot be underestimated.

3-) Resolution: The conclusion of the piece, during which all unresolved musical elements are resolved in a decisive manner.

The performer must prepare the audience for the eventual end of the musical journey, a return to reality. Musical cues which aid this transition include:

·  gradual decrescendo and diminuendo

·  a clear a decisive  end point , so as to not leave the audience with an uneasy feeling of something unresolved

Entertain your audience: Great entertainers (actors, singers, etc.) put their unique personality into every performance. If you want to make a memorable impression upon your audience, introduce a new, unique perspective on your piece. Once you truly own your piece, it should carry the inimitable stamp of your personality, but also sound as if it is being performed for the first time.

Select pieces that are personally meaningful to you, and allow for your maximum expression as both performer and entertainer.

Performances do not have to be memorized, or note-perfect. However, as a courtesy to your audience, please present a work that you have studied attentively, and can play to its completion.

If you make a mistake during your performance, please continue to play without stopping. Apologizing, repeating a previously played section, or stopping will only call more attention to your mistake.

results.description:
Hello Japanese learners! Lately I've been working on getting to know what each of you would like to work on in order to improve your Japanese.

I figured that I need more time to get some decent amount of people ready to gather around and do some actual meet-ups, so first I'm doing this small lecture for all the beginners. I'll be talking about how Japanese language can be learned by non-native speakers and also doing some pronunciation exercise.

For the intermediate & advanced learners, I'd like to get to know what you'd like to learn and expect me to teach! I've been teaching one-on-one lessons to many advanced level learners, and usually used some news articles for summarizing, responding and discussing, and also short novels to learn some flavorful expressions in Japanese.

My teaching style is essentially giving a lot of informations and options to my students, so they can build up their own identity in the language. Especially Japanese has a tremendous variation of expressions, so it's very important to understand both Japanese culture and your own background to merge them into one solid identity.

I will be so looking forward to seeing and supporting all of you guys!

***Meet-Up Information***

Required to have: PayPal Account

Lecture Time: 15:05-15:55

Level: ★☆☆☆☆ (Very Beginning - Introduction)

Purpose & Contents: Getting to know some basic ideas of Japanese language and tips for learning it. Pronouncing all the Japanese sounds from Hiragana chart.

*Handouts will be prepared by the instructor.

Payment: Please submit a payment of $15.00 to '[masked]' on PayPal by May 19th 23:59. If you're booking after 19th, please submit before the meeting. *Payment will be refunded only if the meet-up gets canceled.

*Please check your message box constantly and stay responsive, otherwise members might get dismissed from this meet-up occasionally, since we have RSVP system in terms of payment and attendee limit.

*If we have less than 5 attendees by 19th 23:59, this meet-up will be held at Starbucks (600 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018). *Handouts will be prepared by the instructor.

*Every 4 meet-up attendances get you $10 discount for the instructor's private lessons (Skype & Meet-Up available).
results.name: Japanese Self-Introducing & Practical Phrases for Traveling  [Level: ★☆☆☆☆]

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible. Be prepared to ask strangers if they're part of the Meetup and don't stop asking others if some say no.

Go in the *81st Street entrance* (*not up the big stairs*), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. At 4 PM sit in or stand by the *first row of the #8 benches* inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead past coat check. At 4:15 PM we'll decide who will go see what with whom and wander galleries. 

At 5:30 PM sit on or stand by the *left bench on the 2nd floor balcony* as you face the main entrance. Once everyone has gathered or at 5:40 PM (whichever comes first), we'll get tables in the Balcony Bar for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.

*If you miss the group at the first meeting, post in the Meetup comments (if you can) that you will meet them at the bench on the 2nd floor balcony at 5:30 PM.*
results.how_to_find_us: 81st St entrance: 4 PM Sit in or stand by the first row of the #8 benches inside the Center For Education room, which is straight past coat check. At 5:30 PM sit on or stand by the left bench on the 2nd floor Balcony as you face the main entrance.

results.description:
Hi Roof Gardeners,

Sue has very kindly offered to start our roof gardeners Meetup season in her fabulous roof garden. Come see what improvements she's made with the help of Janet, another talented roof garden Meetup member. The views are terrific and the company is even better.


For the beginners out there - this is a great event and person to talk to about how to start your garden.  Sue started with perrenials - hydrangeas, trumpet vines, clematis, honeysuckle, lilac, hostas, Japanese maple, a recently added hibiscus, and some other stuff. 


For the Yankee fans out there - her terrace is on the 11th floor with a view of Yankee Stadium. For horse racing fans, the Kentucky Derby will be on her TV at 5:30 p.m.


It's a short train ride uptown and well worth it.


The address is 130 Bradhurst Ave. between 148th and 149th., Apt. 1105
Take the A or D train to 145th.  Use the NE corner exit.  (Don't be tempted to use the exits at 147 or 148 because those streets don't go through to Bradhurst.)  After exiting the subway you will be on the corner of 145th and St Nicholas.  Walk east toward Edgecomb.  Walk one more block east to Bradhurst.  Turn left onto Bradhurst.  The building is the Ellington on the Park.
An alternate route is to take the #3 train all the way to the end of the line at 148th and Adam Clayton Powell Blvd.  Walk west on 148th two blocks to Bradhurst.  Turn right on Bradhurst.  

Cheers!

Leslie and Josh

results.description:
"Eulogy For The Dyke Bar" seeks to acknowledge the mass closing of dyke bars across the country. o kick off the night, Ariel Speedwagon will host the world’s much loved Dyke Trivia Night. Queer Memoir will offer up a night of story-telling and performance from across spectrums of age, gender, race, and sexuality. A special performance of Macon Reed's Eulogy Ritual will take place, reflecting nuanced experiences in and around dyke bars, performances both celebratory and lovingly critical acknowledge these spaces that may soon exist only in our shared stories. Guerrilla Dyke Bar take over will end with a performance by DJ ANDRO. Performances start at 4:00pm. Dance Party at 7:30pm.

$7-10 suggested donation, this is a fundraiser for NYC Dyke March.
results.name: Eulogy For A Dyke Bar- Guerilla Take Over and Dance Party

results.description:
Please join us for this at 4pm at B'nai Keshet (99 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair).

This week we will practice Tai Chi led by Joel Friedman. Joel's popular sessions are an interactive introduction to using Tai chi to create a higher level of meditative “listening” both within the individual and with a partner.

We will use walking and stepping as a meditative exercise to create internal balance; yin yang meditative hand movements to create awareness of internal balance of energy and two person exercises to develop listening skills with respect to the internal energy of the other.

This form of listening can be incorporated into all aspects of life ranging from enhancing tefilla, interpersonal communication, sports, health, meditation and self-defense. Led by Joel Friedman,  MD, PhD, scientist (Professor, Albert Einstein College of Medicine), mystic, thirty year practitioner and teacher of tai chi and other Chinese internal martial arts.

Most weeks are meditation led by a small but dedicated group is practicing mindfulness meditation in a Jewish context every Shabbat. There is a beauty and peacefulness when we sit together as a group and support each other's ability to practice. 

The sit leaders alternate each week. 

We frequently begin with a chant, followed by two separate sits with kavvanot (intentions) inspired by the calendar, the weekly Torah portion or our daily lives. All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

<a href="http://www.jmcmontclair.com"></a>
results.name: Shabbat Tai Chi

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
